hqv2TwzFWYjC5zXR0XIkRQ.text: First there is no restroom here. So if you don't have a place to take your food to (ie are a tourist) it's a bit awkward.  It's very small, kind of noisy. EpjZiYiBtNF-cKOX2dhhaQ.text: We saw sign and stopped in. Have not had a good gyro since we left Chicago.  We were definitely impressed and will come back often.

It's a little small inside, but I've only ordered takeout so that's fine by me. If there's a downside, it's that they close at 8pm. Other than that, gyros, hummus, greek fries, kotopita, etc. You really can't go wrong.

I recommend the garlic fries, they are one of a kind!

_LlTneCCT4z17GcxMpQ1bA.text: Really great place, tried it for the first time today and was really impressed.  I got the Chicken Gyro Plate and a Greek salad enough for 2 full meals really fresh ingredients and made really quickly. I'll be going back for sure.

M0L_fxtMFdBI-taH-ts9VQ.text: Just found this great place. I live nearby and I will definitely be going back. Food is fresh and tasty

Almost $30. I didnt even get a receipt from the register I only got the receipt from the CC machine and with no detail of how much exactly was each meal and drinks. Im guessing he just makes up a number. Its hard to say no more to this place because the food is so good but its not the only greek grill in town so we probably wont be back.

8515_sH-ya9chKtJ4RKC2w.text: My husband and I order food here at least once a week. It's conveniently located about 2 mins from our house. Our pick up order is always ready when we get there. The owners are incredibly friendly and welcoming. We love the shawarma (both chicken and gyro), gyro salads, the gyro pitas, and the Greek fries are a MUST! Thanks for feeding us at least once a week. You guys deserve all the five stars for providing us with beyond delicious food and for keeping us alive. Much love.

2yESOVjTMZQZZhiBA_g2yQ.text: Stopped by for the first time and was not disappointed. The Chicken Gyro Salad was delicious, a far cry from your typical 'bowl-of-lettuce' kind of salad. The greens were crunchy, the whole dish was well dressed, and it was surprisingly pretty to look at - but that didn't stop me from diving into my bowl of salad awesomeness.   Continuing the trend of large, tasty food; the Traditional Gyro Pita was great: warm throughout, with a great balance of meat, veggies, and sauce. Happy customer! I will be back to sample more of their menu.

Warm pita served with all meals and baklava for dessert.

lcv20KgAgZnvO7Jnu0QdQA.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch. Their specialty fries are pretty tasty with lots of feta on them.  The meal (an open faced gyro type dish) was very good but HUGE.  I wound up just eating the meat, olives and feta out of it and giving up on the rest.   Delicious food, good service in a quiet place; I'll visit if I'm on the south side again.

z1dfyC9uv_qYZvx3iRA1Qw.text: I'm late on my review for this place but absolutely delish!!!  Customer service is great as well.  Feta fries are wonderful, they have a sauce that gives them a bit of spicy, not hot but just right!!  I fell in love with them.  I love Greek salad and the salad here is worth it, lots of actually green lettuce!  I will def eat here again and again

DE8b7w6AWL8TBX5AaWQKMQ.text: Great little place - I felt like I was welcomed into the home of a lovely Greek woman.  The friendly service and atmosphere was especially appreciated as I was dining solo.  I had a salad with gyro meat and a side of fries.  Everything was very good - standard greek fair, nothing different or spectacular, but all very good.  I had an order of hummus and dolmas to go which made for a nice snack/dinner later in the day.

JnPvTtnqYpGiVz0sVFzlfA.text: We are in town for an event with family and decided to stop here for a bite to eat. As soon as we walked in, I knew this was going to be a great dinner. We were welcomed by Sabrina, our server for the evening, and she was AMAZING!  We absolutely adore her. She gave great recommendations, asked about our kids' likes and dislikes and made sure that we were completely satisfied with our meals. The food was so good. The portions are HUGE which sometimes means that the quality isn't as good, but that isn't the case here. The food is cooked to perfection - the feta, garlic fries are ridiculously good, but if you're looking for more classic dishes, the kabobs and gyro's will not disappoint. Bottom line, if you're looking for excellent food and even better service, head here.   You won't be sorry.

JYQikVMX6xzUaOKbnayBpw.text: May just be the best gyro Greek salad I've ever had. Meat very flavorful and cooked perfectly. Dressing so good and staff very friendly. I'm only visiting Vegas, and really wish this place was in St. Pete!! Highly recommend!!

vqze6eSgsDIGHSOsjvoUOg.text: One of my favorite Greek places in LV!! Always our go to for take-out.  The staff is so friendly! Get the shawarma it's the best I've ever had!

Don't know if it was the fries or the gyro but my stomach was doing tail spins (and not in a good way) after I ate. I was excited to try based on the reviews but in all fairness was NOT impressed. Won't be back.

uO_oR-d35EJTiv0T7leRNA.text: Great food. Personal Service! Love the owners...they really take pride in their food. We always leave happy and full.

gBRRhQjfR-1ebzjOQ1B5bg.text: I lived in Greece for about 5 years. I LOVE Greek food. This restaurant is the second one i've tried in the past 10 years that i can say was totally authentic and delicious! If you are looking real, good Greek food.. this is your place!

IDZ9cE7BkzskuQJtdgimGw.text: Honestly, this is one of the best Greek food restaurants I've ever ordered from! Their Kotopita Spring rolls are amazing in the sauce that comes with it is very tasty! If you're looking for Greek food - definitely check this place out!

kuY5tunoitpVhdWVixSkOQ.text: Chicken kabob I ordered was terrible. Service was non existent. Also they are not Greek if you care about that kind of thing.

8fWqhXsHXl21uCLRUIA65w.text: Authentic Greek food made by Greeks. You can tell the quality of ingredients. Best Tzatziki sauce and the best falafel I have ever tasted. They said it is because they form the balls per order; they are never frozen. The $10.99 combo gives you enough food for 2 meals. Most gyro meat I have ever seen on a sandwich. Excellent dolmas; 6 came with my side choice for the combo. Will come back again whenever I am craving Greek food.

LsuQfZVMtemg3IF0w0g0_g.text: Best Greek food in town!!! Gyro, large and delicious and feta fries to write home about!!!

1yC-rPMm8AzbIpju7DMQ5Q.text: My friend and I decided to eat here not too long ago.  The food we ordered was very TASTY and nicely presented, though the gyro was a bit heavy.  Overall, I enjoyed their food and service very much.    Why then only 2 stars?    I will order take out, but will not dine in again because I feel it is absolutely UNACCEPTABLE to not provide a bathroom for the patrons.  Both my friend and I experienced quite an unpleasant episode where we had to run around to find a restroom.  I am guessing this must be a health department violation and it needs to get fixed.  It made our experience stressful and much less enjoyable.    2 stars for now... once they provide restroom(s), 3.5-4 stars.

SjXYdomqHeTMbpOXvJMJNw.text: Gyro is huge, meat is well seasoned and not dry. The garlic fries are amazing! Great spot for take out!

WnO08O5SUI8rzz3hDXLJAQ.text: Oh my, what a find in one of the many strip malls in Las Vegas.   Small with 4 tables inside. Everyone was so nice; checking in to see how we were doing.   We tried a trio sampler:  Baba ganoush, Dolmades and Kreotopita (spring rolls with ground beef) with a garlic dipping sauce. Of the three we loved the beef spring rolls and dip the best. Everything was fresh made and you could taste it too    Down side is they don't have fountain drinks so they sell cans of soda and water and no public bathroom (you can go to Del Taco across the way).  Even with that I will definitely recommend to family and friends. The food definitely rates 5 stars.

V2hwzW3I_WEUxNe7Uk8iZA.text: This place is absolutely amazing!! I'm not sure how I ever missed this place before!! The gyro is best one I have ever had! Definitely recommend this place to everyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing gyro! Yum!

ZOj45GZoPf0pb1YqstP2KA.text: Went in again yesterday and it looks like they're making improvements to the inside. The owner walked around and spoke with each table - he was particularly really funny with us! The food (as usual) was top notch! Their gyro and garlic feta fries have become one of those foods that I crave on the regular! If I as to give any constructive feedback this time, it would be to speak with the landlord to change the entry handle, as the towel placed over it is sort of odd/gross (but makes sense because the sun makes it so hot). Also, put a sign out front with pictures of the dishes (and maybe a few in the window advertising your gyros and your "special" garlic feta fries! You'll certainly steal away some business from Capriottis next door!

PKSu0cSq8DCVuvzzK3A1uw.text: These guys rock! Perfect For your Mediterranean fix. Spanakopita, Tiropita and Chicken gyros have all been tried and loved. Have always gotten a friendly staff member whether in person or over the phone. Snappy delivery, too. Can't lose with this place.

4P0mFEKGtFXeo3UiU3habA.text: The gyros are tasty but an optical illusion.  The meat is on top and looks like it is filled with meat but the lettuce and tomatoes are occupying all the space under the meat.  It's expensive.   No restroom for customers. Probably wouldn't come back.  I swear, every gyro spot in Chicago gives you a pound of gyro meat.   All of these Las Vegas gyro places give you exactly 6 pieces.    Do yourself a favor and go to Roberto's haha

I-6Ha_KzC20fS7diDgbh1Q.text: I started going here a few years back when it was a tiny whole in the wall and they are probably the best Greek food i've had in Vegas.

W4n1UR3Q5n1v-TUOzqqICA.text: Yanni's is one of my favorite Greek Restaurants in Las Vegas. It's quietly hidden in a corner behind del taco on E Silverado and Las Vegas Blvd. The best part about this place is that it's family owned and operated. I've eaten take out here and dined in. The food was always delicious and quality consistent. The owner is so friendly. He will wander the restaurant checking on his patrons. Food is served fairly quickly. The decor is very home style Greek. It's not the Parthenon inside, but you can tell a family decorated it.  My fave starter items are the Greek Fries and the Spinach Spring Rolls. They are absolutely delicious and crispy. The fries are fantastic alone, add feta, garlic, and dressing....WOW. The spring rolls are such an awesome idea. They taste amazing. Cheese and spinach! My fave entree the Gyro Wrap. It is flavorful and True to my cravings for authentic gyro. I have made this my goto Greek Restaurant for my cravings.

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dk9YYrrZxbIQ_n-RJPbSKg.text: I decided to take a chance on trying this Yanni's Greek Grill out. The lamb skewers I got were chewy and didn't even look like they were completely cooked. The chicken gyro I had looked like a sloppy mess. Although they drenched the chicken in sauce, the chicken was dry and looked old. The garlic feta fries were mediocre. I'll stick to the Yanni's GYROS spot off of Maryland Pkwy and Silverado Ranch. Complete waste of money!

DhVdSh4JGJpuf1DwPri81A.text: Great food. The rice with orzo is not the traditional way, but is fabulous.  I would like the taziki on top of my meat instead of the orange sauce. dVJCYtDKl1XFB4aa9zmW3g.text: Yum yum yum. Every order I have had from here has been delicious and well put together. Even my delivery shows up great. I have had several different options from this place and been completely satisfied. Great job and I definitely recommend the food.

VyR09BkKy6BD-1UTKcY-KQ.text: My go to Greek place. The food is so delicious. I absolutely love their Greek chicken salad, chicken gyro, and the Greek feta fries. The staff is always courteous and ready to help. I've become quite a regular here. I highly recommend this restaurant.

VmDDkwlOLWcH8frLQqY30Q.text: I have gone to this restaurant about a dozen times.  kept going because food and service was top.  I  went there today with family and friends,  we ordered Gyros.   the meat was dry and the pita was burnt.  The woman who took our order was like usual.  when food came the meat was dry and pita was burnt.  I brought it to her attention.  (the meat and pita).  Her remark was that I  wanted the food for free.  NOT TRUE.  I had the money in hand.  she said all I wanted was free food.  I  have never gone somewhere and commented  on how bad the food was to get it free.  .  I  was giving her a tip and she threw it at me.

tZHAAWl_2N_G2crm_nSXMA.text: I ordered through Uber Eats. The order was wrong. We called the restaurant to let them know and were told to call Uber Eats yet she assured us they would correct it. I was put on hold and informed the restaurant could not undo the order it had already been made after calling Uber Eats. I placed the order and tried to remove one item within a matter of 6 minutes. I find it hard to believe it was ready to go that quickly. Especially since they were forewarned with a direct phone call before Uber Eats followed it up with another phone call. Even then it was within 11 minutes of placing the order. That's awful customer service. Never eaten here before. I hope the food is better than the people serving it.

iT8IJTIce2klE_Ht-IwQHw.text: Best Greek food in town!! I believe it's family owned and everything tastes fresh!! I suggest the lemon orzo soup, feta fries and the gyro!!

CFXS4hJ12HGNeSefXFmeSQ.text: Basically a takeout Greek restaurant with around 10 tables.  When eating in, the service is surprisingly professional and personable.  They use high quality ingredients and both their chicken kabob and gyro meet are delicious.  The long grained rice is a nice complement and very tasty.  The salads are also fresh.  Prices on the combo platters that include rice, pita and a decent sized salad are very reasonable.  Their homemade baklava is excellent.

QaXYgePvean6vZeS3ufIbQ.text: I went in for the first time to get to go to take to work.  I got a falafel pita and small salad (no olives).  The salad was delicious and fresh.  The falafel was so salty I couldn't eat it.  It had some kind of brown sauce on it.  I was hoping for Tzatziki sauce.  The pita bread was good, the veggies fresh, just WAY TOO SALTY!  I will try again and hope next time it will be 5 stars.  No more falafel though...

lY2ext5jdh8oWnzTjSYHmw.text: AMAZING food! Today I picked up good here for the first time and staff was extremely nice and ended up giving Me extra baklava since my order wasn't done when I arrived. So incredibly nice :) we absolutely loved the food. Everything tasted fresh and those garlic feta fries...YUMM! We got a gyro combo, Falafel balls and baklava and everything was 10/10! Will definitely be back to try more!

43-ppzUOV1Pmr-V3C-LP_A.text: Amazing! I have yet to find a Mediterranean grill that can top this spot. I've tried but this place puts any other competition to shame. You can't beat the authenticity of this joint. I've wanted to find a different spot that's closer to my house that remotely compares but every other place is just pure disappointment after I've fallen in love with yannis!   Chicken shawarma plate is my absolute favorite. Chicken smells and tastes amazing. Salad is nice and fresh!! Baklava is made by the owners grandma! Super delicious, flakey, and moist!   Legit BEST MEDITERRANEAN FOOD I've EVER had. Even the owners are personable. That remember you personally. Definitely a nice touch.

mTn5-kcYCGH72E67VAQLLQ.text: Rounding down from 4.5. Very good food, made fresh. Good service too. Location is slightly awkward inside with bad lighting but not too bad. Wish they were just slightly less expensive and I'd be here more often!

nfV4hZd0fSKqX3FuT_9BrQ.text: I will be the first to admit, this place does look kind of shaky on the outside lol, but the taste of the food and the service was great.   Oddly enough, this wasn't my first option for food when I came to this strip mall. I was supposed to be going to Capriottis for a sandwich, but they didn't really have any great vegan options. Then I walked over to Del Taco because I was going to settle on a bean and cheese burrito (no cheese) and a bean tostada. But then I thought, I eat Del Taco all the time, this can wait.   Yanni's it was. I pulled out my phone real quick and came right to yelp. The overall rating was solid, so I decided to ignore my first impression of the outside and give it a legit shot.   The inside isn't anything out of Mykonos or Santorini, so don't get your hopes up (LOL). But the fact that people were sitting and eating, as well as the phone/pick up orders kept coming in, I knew this place was doing something right.   This was traditional greek food, but everything in their falafel wrap along with their fries were vegan, so I went with that. The flavor was amazing, if I had time and space in my stomach I would have ordered another, and that was just the wrap. The fries may be the best thing on their menu. I'm talking top 5 all time on my fry list.   Sidenote: The gentleman helping me even got it out quickly for me since I told him I was in a rush (BONUS POINTS).  When in vegas, DO NOT overlook this hidden gym. Check them out!

6Kmc95x_oEpn3pr0JBF7Lg.text: Ordered my food on the eat 24 app it came in about 20 minutes. I ordered the fries with the chicken rice & Greek salad.  My salad was really fresh and was pretty good my rice was really soft I wish they would have given me more rice. There was so much chicken the plate was full with mostly chicken so that makes up for the lack of rice but over all it was definitely a five-star meal worth it!  Also delivery was fast

g5CmwYFuv-tdPTVPLsqXEw.text: In a hurry for a bridal shower, only had a few minutes, I was about to go to Del Taco... Then i saw this place, and thought to myself, "hmm, a greek salad would sure be healthier" so i decided to Yanni's on a whim.  While entering, i noticed there were a few people in line ordering for take out so I could tell this was a trendy/popular spot.  I was greeted by a middle aged woman with a smile.  She helped me decide what to order, which was a filet minion kabob with a salad no onions and no olives, and i told her I wanted to have an ample amount of lettuce on my salad.  My order came in less than 10 minutes, super fast, hot delicious meat on a beautiful thick salad with 3-4 tomatoes and lots of feta.  Also came with a dressing and yogurt sauce.  I gulped every bite.  And felt very satisfied after.  I think I have a new favorite Greek Spot now!! Used to only trust going to Yassou's greek grill but now they have a tough competitor... this place is great!! Super affordable too..  I was impressed by a huge salad and 12 oz of Filet Minion on kabobs for less than $20 after tax!!  Woohoo Ill be coming back for sure.

L4U12KDd92PjE6knH-_ZDg.text: Ruby was an amazing server. This place is awesome! Get the gyro - you can't go wrong. Delicious. Affordable. Great place.

O1s7EVc1kAhdVeuVus-VQQ.text: Gentleman said they cut the meat from the grill and cannot get extra meat When I opened plate , it looked packaged meat from a grocery store . Asked for no garlic and there was more garlic then a garlic factory . Thank you

SNzGFtpyYJ2rBVWWGmI7nQ.text: A hole in the wall with a limited menu but man do they do what they do very well. I ordered simple steak kabob and garlic fries and it was off the chart. Flavor, flavor, flavor. I order this at other Greek places but it's never been this good. It's close to my house so I can already see myself coming up here frequently. Well priced and will exceed your expectations.

qn_7On8BrSvxPbzfarWQog.text: First of all, the owner and cashier of this place is the sweetest man alive. Customer service is at top notch.  Second of all, we ordered a lamb gyro, garlic feta fries, spanikopita, stuffed grape leaves, some other kind of kopita I cannot remember, and baklava.  Everything came out prompt, and the food was incredible. The garlic feta fries were out of this world. The lamb in the gyro was moist and tender. The spanikopita and "other" kopita were crispy, hot, cheesy, and delicious. My husband was very suspicious of the stuffed grape leaves, but ended up loving them. The texture can be a bit off-putting if you don't know what to expect, but they were doused with lemon-y goodness and went well with the fried portion of our meal, as a nice offset.  The baklava was covered in sticky, honey goodness.  Next time I'm craving Greek, we'll be back.  The ONLY downside is that it is 40 minutes away on the other side of town!

vZ4cR3Af4pjwl71Vewk9pQ.text: Delicious! Comparable to the primo Mediterranean food I enjoy back home in the San Francisco Bay Area. Reasonable prices for the quantity and quality of the food. Quick and friendly service. Authentic Greek food. Yum.

k6EBrM-vohNkudZvIkVbZA.text: Delicious food, good sized portions, and excellent service.  You can tell everything is freshly made and not from a can.  The portions are very generous.  The Gyro meat smelled and tasted like steak.  The seasoning on the chicken gyro was delicious. The baba ganoush was yummy with a smokey flavor.   Will definitely be back.

gVKed8hJtj76pJ-0TSfipQ.text: I have 3 words for you:  Garlic Feta Fries.  These fries are easily 5 stars.  They are garlicky, cheesy and stinkin' delicious.  Their gyros, hummus, pita and gyros salads are excellent too but i come back for the fries.   The dining room is small and there's no public restroom for customers.  Service is somewhere just below friendly.

pAn6kKH0veHTNJL4atWFJg.text: Garlic fries are Aaaaaaamazing!!!! Place is clean and Yanni serves you herself! Food is fresh and delicious.

_gNlQRiMl-N2PadRSTOymA.text: This place is super authentic and really really good! Probably one of the best Greek restaurants I've been to. The owner is really nice and he let me have a two meat combo on my salad that's not on the traditional menu! So happy with our experience!

nSfULmANwSExFam9P_7DrA.text: Absolutely fantastic food.  Very reasonable prices. I defiantly plan to come again next time I am in vegas!

The entire meal was great and the price was reasonable. I didn't eat there, took it to go but the dining room was small and quaint and the staff was very friendly. I noticed a sign saying they were to expand the dining room area sometime in 2016.  When I'm in the mood for Greek again, I'll definitely look to eat here again.

The owners were so nice and made my first experience a memorable one! You can count on me and my husband returning!

usAkGIeLIc3Qm8dF7EsE6Q.text: I got an order of the gyro sandwich. The meat was dry, but savory. Overall the sandwich was decent.  Someone in my group ordered the side hummus. What a small order for the price... the flavor was just okay too.

jboLQJYXwhoQkcZ7hkgX_w.text: I've order regularly from here and usually they are 5 star but today wasn't the day apparently. The lamb skewer I ordered have 3/5 pieces were raw on the inside and the gyro on my platter was a bunch of dried up slices. Have to say somewhat disappointed.  If a restaurant can't be consistent it's a turn off.

ggo3Yg1DBqMI08nxcZEKUQ.text: This has to be one of, if not the best Greek restaurants I've been to. The service was great and the food was excellent. I highly recommend you check out this place. The prices were also very reasonable.

DhGpaypEyKq6sCZRR7rGvA.text: Stopped in today after watching a show last night where someone was having a gyro.  So i yelp gyro to find the closest one.  Lucky for me it was yannis.  I have been to the middle east so i am familiar with their style of kabob and shawarma.   But this was my first "real" gyro.  I think i had one back in the 90s when all the fast food places were making their version.  So lets dive into the food.  The portion was perfect.  Hungry guys every where should be happy.  I probably could have only had half but in the spirit of yelp i had to ensure that the last bite was as good as the first.  I ordered the traditional gyro combo woth garlic feta fries.  First bite was a fry.  DELICIOUS.  Crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside.  They were garlicy but why order garlic fries if thats not what you're into.  It also had some sort of fry sauce lightly drizzled on it.  Not sure what it was but neither added or detracted from the fries as a whole.  I think the buffalo sauce that they removed from previous reviews would have been okay on the3 side.l but they were good as is. The gyro was super good.  None of the individual ingredients tried to take the lead but together it was bliss.  I did try the meat by itself.  Great flavor and some of the pieces were crispy and some had more chew.  It was great.  For dessert i had some baklava.   I mran it was sitting there all by itself on the counter and needed me to save it from its plexiglass prison.  It tasted like all baklava ive had before.  Sweet cinnamon and yummy.  The staff was also very friendly.  The guy at the register was very nice.

YeCfO2DM8Gbw-vTqv4EdAA.text: Great experience. Gyro was great and garlic fries were insanely good. Will make a stop there when back in town again for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Well worth a stop. Classic Gyro and feta, garlic fries.

CxzJRxZnynayqikAilV0Yg.text: We really like this place ! We stopped here on our way to Cali, the food was fresh and tasty and the place was very clean. We will definitely be back! I got the chicken gyro and the feta fries mmmm!

yEWt9ts7kJHGsuMpaVNvzA.text: I went there on a Saturday afternoon and I kept driving by it. It's very small and definitely a takeout rather than a dine in place.   Moving right along, the whole reason I went is because I'm obsessed with chicken lemon rice soup and went there just to order this. I get to the counter and place my order but they have run out :( I'm disappointed. It's only like 4pm.    So I order a Greek salad and a shawarma plate. Very salty. Everything was so salty. And I love salt! I usually add it to everything. Maybe an off day? Who knows? I haven't been back since nor do I plan on it.   Owner was nice and very apologetic about the soup situation which is why they got 2 stars.

Still, they turn out some good Greek food.  We tried the beef/lamb shawarma pita and it was pretty delicious.  Their fries and their meat have good crunch to them, which could be off-putting, but I like it!

D_P2RimMET83046CPHmvHw.text: You want great Greek food made by a Greek family? This is the place to go.   We were passing through on our way back to CA and wanted someplace close to freeway. What we got instead was an amazing food experience. I had the chicken gyro and the rest of my party had the regular gyro. We got a mix of the garlic fries and salads as our sides. EVERYTHING was delicious. Best of all was YaYa's (grandma) baklava and as a Greek as well, my other half really knows what he's talking about!  Additionally, our son was ill. They gave him a bowl of rice and a Gatorade and asked several times how he was doing. So kind to go out of their way for him.

OMmEf6s3bRbmORO9-eI9bg.text: Excellent food and reasonably priced. No bathroom or ice. Other than that its great. Definitely going on my lunch spot list.

oTaoydWkTlHKOKKrKjZtmQ.text: Excellent service, unfortunately their food did not cut it for us. They a heavily welcomed father and son shop by the locals. We wanted to order a shawarma, but they ran out of batter. I vaguely remember reading somewhere they offer huge portion size which is  incorrect. Our fries look like a half order compared to the average orders elsewhere. The meat lacked taste and the stuff grapeleaves (dolmades) was overly smushy. Giving two star because they kindly offered to replace with another item.

tF6BuWnRny57wH4k4YO9Bg.text: I've tried and tested many different Greek places, but Yanni's is by far my favorite. I cannot get enough of the chicken gyro! it tastes so incredibly fresh and their tzatziki sauce is perfectly on point.  If you haven't tried this place yet, it's worth the jump. I would definitely also recommend trying different items on the menu because they will not disappoint you.

If I lived in Vegas I would definitely go back but I was just traveling through. Maybe next time.

Lrxlp5Vdov8PFKCjG4xsAw.text: Shawarma plate was delicious! Seasoned great! Sides of warm pita bread and Greek salad was pretty good as starters. XS-BQvT7hkh7bpQiLId37Q.text: Was in the mood for a Greek salad so turned to my trusty yelp app to identify a Greek restaurant that was serving up some yummy food and landed on this place here. So glad that I did!  While Stephano's is my usual Greek salad restaurant, I was down south of the strip and thought this might be a nice alternative based on the yelp reviews. When I walked in there was only one other gentleman in the restaurant (about 1:30pm?) This is a real family run restaurant, and it reminded me of my mother taking my order which is fantastic!  They don't really have a grilled chicken kebab salad on the menu so we ordered the grilled chicken kebab lunch with two sides of salad. Take a look at the picture as it was delicious looking and tasting.  Would I go back? Sure you bet! So here's the rundown:  Satisfied? Yes  Return? Yes  Advocate? Yes

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken kebab with two sides of salad (grilled chicken Greek salad)

JYgrAjsPDnbD1s7fZhJXGw.text: Yet another solid option for Greek food in Las Vegas. All of the local Greek restaurants have their own unique way of preparing Greek favorites and this restaurant is no different.  The restaurant decor is minimal, but clean and uncluttered. There are about a dozen tables and a lounge area. The restroom was also very clean. The service was great and our waitress was very attentive. She checked on us often and had our food and drink out to us quickly.  I ordered the Gyro Platter and found it to be delicious and filling. The salad was fresh and had a nice dressing on top. The gyro meat was the best I've had. It was moist and well seasoned with a nice crust on the outside. The rice served with the gyro meat was well prepared, but would have been more exciting with some nuts, dried fruit, or herbs.   My husband ordered a Gyro with a side of Feta Fries. He agreed that the gyro meat was some of the best he's ever had with the crust being the best part. The Feta Fries were delicious! The fresh feta really made the flavor and the sauce drizzled on top was delicious with the crispy fries.

The babaganosh is some of the worse I have had, but the hummus isn't bad, it isn't amazing either. The meat was really dry and looked like weird thick deli meat. So, that wrapped in a pita sponge with some lettuce and tomatoes, very disappointing. The staff is always super pleasant and nice. I would say two stars, but the fact that they do not have tabbouleh salad vs yet another lettuce salad, kills it for me.

MMhsOxKKNVrXD4qSNNjHdw.text: The best Mediterranean cuisine in vegas! It's a hidden gem. My personal favorite is the chicken kebab and the garlic fries!

DtrrD_zzxq-Yc3VZHuIvDQ.text: Opa!! Amazing!  Delicious! I am definitely a fan.  I have never had Greek or Mediterranean food before.  I had lamb once and never again I told my self.  I really wanted to give it another try.  Let me tell you!!! It was not a disappointment.  The lady that served us was kind and patient with us.  Bring it was out first time trying this type of food she took the time to answer all of our curious questions.  She even brought out a sample of lamb for us to taste before we ordered!  We ate all the samples lol and ordered.  I got the combo which came with a side.  I got the gyro shawarma and my side was the feta fries.  The fries was soooooo goooooooddd enztra crispy and the sauce and cheese really gave it that extra deliciousness.  My gyro was huge! I was full not even halfway through but it was so good i kept eating lol.  Definitely coming back!!!

3MrD7NrEWGd4wLa7rT_WIA.text: This place has some bomb greek food! I live closer to The Great Greek on blue diamond and that's my usual go-to spot, but I'll def take a drive here anytime.  I ordered takeout - the Athenian chicken platter, sub feta fries instead of rice pilaf. Chicken was SO moist and flavorful, pita bread was very soft, and portions were huge. The feta fries could be improved on, I think the Great Greek has them beat on the feta fries. And unfortunately they don't have the avgolemono soup on the menu. But still, this place rocks

rpS-yskqBf6Huiu0dRNoOw.text: I'll echo what everyone else has said about this place: you wouldn't expect great food from this place, especially based on what it looks like from the outside. Don't judge a book by it's cover, and just dive in. At Yanni's its damn worth it.  I was driving into Vegas, and needed a quick snack before a dinner that was later in the day. Came across this place on Yelp, and knew I had to give it a shot. I'm glad I did.  We ordered just two plates to share: The garlic feta fries and the chicken kabob plate.  Garlic Feta Fries - Fried to perfection and topped with a generous portion of feta along with a garlic sauce. Such a great bite after a long day of driving.  Chicken Kabob Plate - Comes with a good-sized Greek salad that's as bright as it is refreshing. "Clean eating" is what comes to mind. The plate comes with two skewers on top of rice and a side of tangy yogurt sauce. Great flavor on the chicken, and with the yogurt it was very good.  All I can say is that even though I came for a "light" snack, this was a great meal. I was surprised at how large the portions were, and left stuffed. Service was great. It seems like they have a lot of regulars!

czf2KztYE1-QJPsCeJTzIQ.text: The food here is amazing. I had there Lamb kabob with rice and a side of salad and was tempted to lick the plate when I was done. There Tzatziki sauce was so fresh and had this bright refreshing taste that I can't even put into word. I never new I could love Tzatziki so much. I'm definitely gonna start being a regular here.

sHpVStGl7WOqYffdLJWnLg.text: Pretty good food. Seems to be a little overpriced for what you get. Gyro was good, the feta fries were amazing.

pYAmoHizFalU1ZYy3o2eZQ.text: Outstanding gyros, best I've had in Vegas after 15 years here.  Lots of meat and nice presentation.  The restaurant is clean and the staff is super polite. q9A_lTZ0RfuxtV65Jsfu-g.text: Best gyro in town!! Overall fantastic place to get Greek food. Staff is super friendly! Chef Mikey is amazing!!! Good people and great food!!

ZigfWrTKJ2dvqoTHv1pX4w.text: Amazing chicken gyro and garlic feta fries!!  I would highly recommend going here if you want some great geek food.  Plenty of seating inside but I usually carry out which they are always timely as well!! 5 stars for sure!

pLeAPn5UCIaFWztV6QG1Dw.text: Best Gyro in town. They are the real deal. Combination of ground beef and lamb made on the pemisis.  Everything here is authentic and fresh. I have found my Gyro nirvanna. Yipee! By the way, super nice staff as well.

e3af31vf4CjLip3RmyLnig.text: Yummy food Super Nice staff and live music. Even had a shot with the owner. Awesome time!

o394sjdCF7btNtnr5Wh_Tg.text: YYYYYAAAAAAAAANNI  This review should begin with 5 stars...  When I was a little person, I used to love Greek night. Dad would break out the frying pan and get busy on some Gyro and the smell would fill the air and appetite or not, I immediately found a hunger. And every time I had it, I was fat and happy.  But I didn't know what good Gyro was until I found this hidden gem. Kitty corner from the South Point casino you can find a Gyro as big as a football and loaded with flavors that taste like they were pulled from Mother Nature herself. The meat is like bacon on steroids and seasoned with just enough spice to compliment the tzatziki sauce. Fresh lettuce and ripe tomatoes fill out the remainder of the pita.  When I sat down, I was only slightly hungry, I had only planned on eating half. I was three bites in when I realized only an idiot wouldn't finish it.  It may be a little further than your other places, but no matter the distance, it's worth the trip.  Eat up!   Ps-it only lost the last star cause the decor isn't completed yet (although when it does, it's going to be very inviting and filled with beautiful art. Pps-I may be a stick in the mud, but when I tried to go compliment the cooking, no one was around to hear. Service industry, someone always has to be listening.  ***but don't let my assholeness get in the way of what I promise will be at the top of your 'best things I've ever eaten'

skcoUy3wxx-Hwz8bzIRueA.text: I thoroughly enjoyed a gyro salad on my last night in the area. After a long day of sightseeing I actually finished the enormous salad. Meat was tasty as was the yogurt sauce. I am used to it having more tang, but it was still good.

4FLBLkKCcJNfGuBxJTg1Cw.text: This may sound a bit silly, but I've never actually been to Yanni's; delivery only! Working the hours that we do, there are some nights where my roommate and I just want to lay on the couch and order in, and pizza every time just isn't an option. So, we stumbled upon Yanni's and they did not disappoint! The Greek salad is pretty standard but delicious nonetheless. All the pitas I have tried are superior to most Greek places I've been: they're very big and the meat is high quality. My personal fave is the garlic feta fries which are AMAZING; a must try. Delivery is extremely quick (sometimes 15 minutes) and the food never disappoints; two simple reasons for my repeat business.

The Greek style fries was awesome and I have been to a lot of Greek restaurant's but the feta cheese this location uses was really good! Loved the chicken and the spices they used!

pTDEEVEYSwF7XQ4m1KUCMg.text: This place is amazing. A tiny little hidden gem in South Las Vegas!  The Greek fries are a must order. Portions are large and the service was great.  The owner is super friendly. Make sure to order the baklava.  We will definitely be coming back soon!

HxMtT8dvADT1mXN9aNcZ6g.text: I've been to the majority of Greek/Mediterranean restaurants in vegas and yannis Greek grill (not to be confused with yannis gyros) is top 3. It's hole in the wall feel is charming and makes you feel at home and that you know it is going to be authentic Greek food! All orders come with fresh, warm pita bread that I could've ate by itself. The dolmades are huge and stick together when you bite into them which is rare! Comes with taziki for dipping, but they're so flavorful you don't even need it! The Greek salad was simple but delicious. Their portions are huge too. The chicken shawarma came with a sauce.. I have no idea what it was but it made the dish even more delicious than it was. This might be my new Greek spot!

z3sgEZ9yrADCmNl-ZNyp6A.text: One of my Greek go-to's is Yanni's. They open a new location or move somewhere else, somehow, I tend to find them. This location is the tiniest one I've been to so, the best thing to do is to call for a to-go order.  Chicken Gyro: Chicken, tzatziki, onions and tomatoes. The pita is warm and fluffy. The chicken is not dry. 4/5  Beef/Lamb Gyro: Beef/lamb, tzatziki, onions and tomatoes. 4/5  Garlic Feta Fries: They have my favorite Greek fries in town. Garlicky, flavorful, tangy yet creamy feta on top of crispy fried potatoes.  You could give me a bucket of these fries and tell me that's all I can eat all day and I'll be more than happy. Yuuuuummm!!!  5/5  Baklava: It's average. I rarely order baklava from here because I'd rather spend my calories on their fries. 3/5  I'm a creature of habit. So, I always get my gyro, fries + black tea combo everytime I come here and life is good.

eyoCFxo4jxDOlvch2Toy1w.text: I LOVE greek food and have been searching for a good place in Vegas. Unfortunately my old go-to was a victim of the recession.  I saw Yanni's on yelp a few weeks after it opened and so far all the reviews were excellent.  They were not busy when we stopped in. The owner himself waited on us. He was a pleasant guy, said he'd been in the business something like 35 years. The other staff were quite friendly as well, chatting with us as they prepared the food. My husband is a gyro fan and he was very pleased with the quality, taste and portion size. Myself, I go for the lamb souvlaki.  It was perfectly cooked - not too over done and dried out as I've had a lot of places do. Portions size was good as well and their tzatziki sauce is delicious. Definitely our new favorite greek restaurant! We will be back - many times!

ge37wP_X1juWmbu5km2gIg.text: We saw the good reviews so thought we would give it a shot. Food was excellent and service was great! They give you a pita on the side and next time I will make sure to order a second one because it was a little small for all the food they give you. They have a small sitting area so it is def a much more of a take out kinda spot which is fine with us. Can't wait to go back already!!

F27XUc92zz7D0fh9M39n8Q.text: Beyond disappointing! I got the chicken gyro salad and my husband got the chicken gyro plate with the feta fries. The "chicken" on my salad were like little rocks. They were so hard they were inedible and if I didn't place the order myself I wouldn't be able to distinguish what type of meat it was. It had the weirdest flavor! The lettuce itself was bitter and very off-putting which I've never experienced in a salad before. My husband had the same issue with the gyro given that it was the same ingredients but his feta fries were absolutely amazing. If you're going to this place looking for great fries, you won't be disappointed. If you're going for actual Mediterranean food don't waste your time or your money.

P6UbvqhUpBhhyVXdt_yoww.text: I am very disappointed to leave this review. I work in close proximity to this restaurant and our office has ordered large orders numerous times. Unfortunately we have ordered for the last time.  Yanni's has started to use Uber eats. We ordered a large order through the app. And requested a few substitutions-as we have numerous times in the past without issue.  This time, some of the orders had correct subs and some of them were disregarded all together.  No one from our party was exceptionally please. Some mentioned it was "ok" but not anything special. Not what we had become accustomed to. Some of the comments were that the gyro meat was dry and on the salty side. The greens in the salads were wilted. The tzatziki sauce was runny. The hummus had an off, somewhat acidic flavor  Our office is a little more than one mile down the same street from the restaurant and yet delivery took almost an hour and a half. The Uber delivery driver said the restaurant had sent their apologies in the delivery time and said they got behind on orders. This would have been understandable and an explanation for the previously mentioned issues. I could have chalked it up to a "one off" experience.  Unfortunately, the dagger came while I was picking out the onions (I had specifically requested none) from my salad. I found a nice dead fly staring back at me. Unknown if anymore were present as I tossed the meal after taking this picture

kj1Y7Szm0vzf97mkSwxE2w.text: Worst Meal I ever ate in Las Vegas. I should not have ate here when I saw other tables with uneaten food left to throw away. I now understand why customers don't eat this food. It tastes like garbage.  The falafel is dry and salty. It tastes like a pound of salt was added. When I complained to the owner she admitted that it is not made fresh it comes from a premixed mix. Why not make falafel fresh like other Greek Restaurants?  1) Its too hard  2) we are short handed Excuses for serving garbage store brought salty mixes?   My teenager could have made a better Greek meal. Stay away from this gross restaurant if you are smart. THE WORST GREEK FOOD OF MY LIFE. Don't make the same mistake I did. Choose any other Greek restaurant in Vegas. The other ones serve fresh Greek food.

IFeljytEnHifDEF-x66utA.text: Don't let the location on Vegas boulevard in a strip mall fool you. This is hands down some of the best Greek food in Las Vegas. Hands down my favorite dish.  3. service - very friendly. The lady at front counter is accommodating and very nice when I messed up my own order by accident.

OSS0MCm3WKZqiw-bHS5BIA.text: I just had the Greek salad with shawarma and oh my God it was so good...I am definitely coming back every time I come to Vegas! 5 stars all the way!!!

OhVGE0oA1BDK9RHgwHwAZg.text: Bland and dry. Quality has gone down over time and worse when ordering through delivery apps (orders are always missing something, instructions not read properly)   Much better choices coming up around the area. No thanks anymore.

vtX1X51alLPQVoRg4_2Gcg.text: Great food, smelled and tasted fantastic. Prices very affordable. We will be coming back soon.Very nice and helpfully staff.

L-RMI1UMdRPcueo-ym5Lrg.text: Holy lamb kabob!!! This place rocks! Too lazy to go get food so I ordered from Uber eats... if it tasted this amazing after a car ride... I can't even imagine eating in! I love Greek food. I've had Greek food all over Vegas. This is by far the best! The rice pilaf... Epic. The seasoning of the meat, the hummus. The egg roll thing with spinach ... a must try!! I have tried many versions of baklava and I never enjoyed it. I ordered it out of pure experimental judgment with the hope that maybe once I would enjoy it. I was not disappointed! They took a dessert that I would normally rate a zero to a one and made it a 10! I will definitely be ordering again! And coming in to enjoy strait from kitchen!

pvWvlmG3m1rqrP1bZwjKiA.text: I'd been driving by this restaurant for a few years and just never stopped in. It's not the only Greek restaurant my family eats at. Schwarma, gyros and the kebabs are consistently good and the portion sizes are pretty large in my opinion. We've never been disappointed with our meal here.

iv0UKQGgfXUBrYjAdIOJbg.text: The spanikoputa spring rolls were an amazing start...I could make a meal out of the two generously sized rolls that are the appetizer! I had the gyro platter and was very pleased. The lamb was seasoned well and had a slight char around the edges, the pita bread was soft and chewy, and I even really enjoyed the rice (I am not usually a huge fan of rice, but this had a nice flavor to it)! I also ordered a side of babaghanoush, which was delicious  (although I wish they had given us a larger portion for $4.50...at least filled up the container!) I did order one extra order of pita bread for the babaghanoush and an extra tzatziki sauce, because I like lots of sauce! I had Uber Eats deliver it and everything was hot and fresh when it arrived. I will definitely order from Yanni's again!

w164Fyvd8rQzV42BRENNUg.text: I'm very conflicted about this place. It has hands-down some of the best Greek food in town but the lady working the front is one of the rudest people I've ever seen in a restaurant. She was short-tempered with the rest of the staff and was curt and rude to the customers. It's a real shame because their pita falafels and garlic feta fries are some of the best food in town. I'll definitely keep ordering online but I'll stay away from actually going in.

oGs0zMT0uDYvoV7JnD1Hug.text: Don't get me started on the baklava--it's a secret family recipe that I would pay for if I could--well I do, because I buy it every time I go to Yanni's. Sometimes I stop by to get it to-go because it's THAT good. Not just a pregnancy craving; which by the way, this place passes the test of pregnancy nose friendliness and tastiness. The gyros are SO big, like, I can never finish one. And I'm eating for two so that's saying something. Their feta fries are things dreams are made of and everything is fresh, authentic, and so delicious. I live 3 minutes walking distance but I'd be happy to drive an hour to eat here. Definitely my top 10 fav restaurants in Vegas. Don't pass this place up--it's hidden in a strip mall but don't let that fool you for a high quality, amazing meal. Will be going back again and again...and again!

ZqqBD_nwpqzKpbTMvAiaVg.text: Went for the first time with a group of 10. Service was great and the food was delicious. Got the hummus and pita, filet mignon kebab with garlic feta fries and orzo rice. Everything was so good! The garlic fries were amazing! Got baklava for dessert and it was delicious! We will definitely be back!

2XlOths101PXK01jButaHw.text: This more than satisfies the Greek in me. Husband had the gyro and I had the Shawarma With garlic feta fries, Greek salad and pita bread. All very authentic and flavorful. Portions  large and had leftovers to take home with additional pita bread. The baklava is the best I've ever had! We have family here and we visit a couple times a year. Yanni's will be a must visit from now on!!

iDgwxSqikGQ1eOOtXJt0bQ.text: I love this place and love Yanni! He's actually the person who made me fall in love with Greek food. Now I can't get enough of the chicken gyro salad. It's a good size salad. For the ladies, I usually can't finish the whole thing in one sitting. Greek feta fries are delicious!!! Not sure if he has moussaka at this location but I tried it at his old spot in Silverado Ranch and it was super yummy!!!   Yanni also takes good care of his customers. I'd visit him wherever he opened a restaurant because it's guaranteed to be delicious!

She explained the different options since I wanted chicken, salad, and the oh-so-tasty garlic fries. Def my new lunch break stop!

ipAMSL7ZG-P8Cjd5d_uwWg.text: Combo deal is well worth it. Loaded with shaved meat lettuce and fixins. They offer a variety of options for the side but garlic feta fries are the way to go.

R4-dadN2bQfvxrYqUcsGkA.text: The food is really good here I always order my food to go but the inside looks great too. I was never a big fan of greek food till I found this place.

SYLn7VtE_w9MyBmLESHvHQ.text: This was a great/random find during the last leg of our drive from LA to Vegas. Restaurant has plenty of seating and good AC (important when it was 100+ degrees outside). There was some confusion when we first walked in - we weren't aware they wouldn't take dine-in orders before seating us at a table. Table service was a bit sporadic as they kept forgetting items but they fixed it quickly.   We ordered the chicken kebab plate and garlic feta fries to share and were surprised at how much food it came with. Salad came in a separate bowl and was really well-balanced, with plenty of toppings, and was really crisp and refreshing. Chicken kebab plate came soon after and was cooked and seasoned perfectly. Fries were also perfectly crispy though I wish they had a little bit more sauce. They brought the pita bread after we were nearly done, but it came out warm and fluffy. Both of us were stuffed by the end of the meal.   This will definitely be on my list for my next trip to Vegas! Hoping the service was a little bit better, but nothing to ward me away.

FSjHAaX3MkNx-NOAsfgIHg.text: Same owner as the now closed Greek Village Cafe and Yanni's Gyros on Maryland Pkwy (he sold about a year ago, but the new owner kept the name). It's pretty much the same menu as the location on Maryland, I ordered the Gyro Pita again, but this time got the Garlic Feta Fries for my side instead of Hummus & Pita.   The place is small, it's counter service. There are two tables inside and one table outside.  So I had decided to take it to go.   I remembered from my previous visit to Yanni's that I wasn't a huge fan of the tzatziki, it had too much dill for my liking, just my personal preference. The pita was warm and soft, but the gyro meat (a combo of lamb and beef) was a bit dry this time around, and it had a slight discoloration on one side of the meat, like the part that was on the outside of the spit, maybe too long. The garlic fries were pretty good. Guess I'm underwhelmed.

cDTyxVuzEs-QgxE0l1xykw.text: First time here and it will be my last.  I had the gyro salad and was immediately turned off when I heard them frying my gyro meat.  It wasn't taken from a spit.  I hoped I was imagining it but when it got to me I could see the oil on the gyro meat.  It tasted doughy!  They also had owners or employees just having around in the eating area.  Also it was somewhat filthy, curtains, ceiling, floor and bathroom...... disgusting!

I2nHHpEqEpBnusC1SRqfsw.text: Glad to see so many great reviews for Yanni's.   I had the food delivered through a service.  Love Mediterranean food, so I opted for Yanni's because of its nearby location to my residence, and because I was hungry and did not want to wait long.   I ordered the appetizer falafel balls and the gyro platter.  Serving sizes were more than I expected, that's great.  However, I found the food very salty, that's bad.  Falafel was not fresh and tasty, it was salty.  Salad that came with the platter was fresh, but the meat was salty.  I am trying to eat healthy, and salt is not a healthy choice.  Guess I found Yanni's not worth its salt!

aczXCkOCIzzNkW6rB0UXpg.text: The food here is amazing! Best hummus we have found in Las Vegas. The service is amazing, the food is cooked to perfection. The quality of the food is also amazing. Ask for extra garlic sauce, it's made in house and will leave you craving it daily!

Based on its 4.5 star rating, I knew it was worth checking out.  I ordered the chicken shawarma salad and chose to eat it there while I did a little bit of workstation the table. My dish arrived at the table no more than ten minutes later with a fresh basket of warm pita.  The portion was perfect, the dressing wasn't too heavy and the chicken had the most amazing blend of spices.  This restaurant is on the opposite end of the city for me but I would be more than willing to make a special trip and done here again.  I can't wait to introduce this place to my hubby (we're both foodies) and I'm excited to try everything on the menu.

No8VEoFX9wVQ1xlsce6qZg.text: Wow!!! Was a bit apprehensive because the restaurant was empty... the blinds were shut and it looked closed...but so glad we stayed! I seriously might have to come back tomorrow before we leave vegas. Waitress was super sweet and attentive too. highly recommend, well worth leaving the strip for!

6jIt2rPS1zdEbIHfF8NERQ.text: I've been trying to eat here ever since our last Vegas trip when someone told us that these guys have the best gyros ever. On our drive in from Vegas last week we stopped by.  We got seated right away and the host/server/cashier was very friendly. Unfortunately we waited over 15 minutes for a server to come and take our drink and food order so we just left. There was only one other couple in the restaurant so I don't know why it tiook so long to get service. On our way out a server said he was walking to our table to get our order but at that point it was already too late.   It was a shame because I really wanted to try this place. We tried to come back before we left but couldn't find the time. I'll review this restaurant again after we have the food.

IGJVg5aVpyqFu5xYkVqiiA.text: My fave Greek place hands down. I LOVE the chicken shwarma plate. Consistently yummy an I've eaten it at least a dozen times - have never had a poor experience. The staff are super friendly too!

4VyHfpP4M2UK9krLRqkrkQ.text: Stopped here on a whim. Was looking for a grocery store and decided to grab lunch first. I'm a fan of Greek food and love the occasional gyro, especially as it brings back fond memories of the 'Gyro Guy' who ran a stand on the Main Street running through campus town. As a student, we used to get these delicious authentic gyros after a long night at the bars.   Yanni's gyros are better in just about every conceivable way. They were excellent and far better than I expected for a small shopping center restaurant. I mean they were really really good and I ate mine almost an hour after receiving (takeout). I would even say they're better than the few I had in Greece.  I would highly recommend stopping by Yanni's for a the next time you're looking for Greek or something different than the norm. Thanks for the delicious meal guys!

C528Iz7ju5KIrQuAmeAy4Q.text: WOW I haven't had Greek food in a long time. I was driving through Vegas and stopped for lunch because they had great Yelp reviews. Yummy  I'll be taking the baklavas to go:) they are located in a strip mall with parking right up front so you can roll on out of here with a full belly.

dYOHfa5B4fYMm7CLAOj0VA.text: Delicious Greek food in Vegas... we had the app sampler and gyro platter, followed by baklava. The app sampler included domades, falafel balls and the pita with taztizki . The gyro platter with rice was also great. On top of wonderful food, the service was also fantastic. Overall decor and ambience is a little cheesy but also awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kuE0QbdgqXpJVa8ELh_4hA.text: Yanni's Greek Grill is so worth the drive for flavorful Greek cuisine. The restaurant is located on the corner of South Las Vegas Boulevard and East Silverado Ranch. You'll see a Shell Gas Station as a landmark, it's in the Silverado Junction plaza and the restaurant is next to a tattoo shop.   I ordered the Chicken Shish Kebob Plate ($12.99) which comes with two skewers of grilled chicken on a bed of Orzo Rice Pilaf and a side of tzatziki sauce. The meal includes a small Greek Salad and Fresh Homemade Pita Bread. For appetizer, I chose Garlic Feta Fries ($3.50) which are seasoned fries topped with feta cheese, garlic sauce, spice paprika, and parsley. I love the addition of feta cheese and garlic sauce, it just makes the fries more fun to eat.   Now they do make the meal fast, it was around 15 minutes when my order came. The chicken kebob taste tender and flavorful especially when you eat it with tzatziki. And I am hooked on the Orzo Rice Pilaf, it's a nicely seasoned savory rice and they make it so fluffy and delicious. The Greek Salad is an added bonus, it has fresh crisp romaine lettuce topped with baby sliced cucumbers, red onions, kalamata olives, juicy tomatoes, feta cheese, spice paprika, a light drizzle of olive oil, and every ingredient in the salad is fresh. I love how my meal makes me feel good. Everything taste amazing.  The dining area is open and very spacious, it's like a happy place. The walls are painted in a pretty blue color which makes objects and artwork stand out. They add a silk flower to every table to give it a personal touch. Also there is an elevated lounge area where you can sit comfortably as a group and enjoy friendly conversations. The service is on point, there isn't a wait, your meal gets made fresh, the food is served fast, and they make you feel welcome. Now the highlight of my day is the amazing food and entertainment. My dining table is right next to the TV and I was excited when they started featuring Furious 7. It's the best day ever.

3_AFKlGpkeyCljgWEkiO6Q.text: Who serves cold dolmades???! I just got back from a vacation in Greece and was missing the food . Now I know it's not going to be exactly the same but I was expecting some similarities especially since I've had Greek food in town before. I ordered a pita combo with fries and a plate of dolmades. The dolmades came out ice cold and I immediately thought ok someone forgot to warm these up. When the waiter came back with the rest of the food I asked about it and she stated they were served cold there and they didn't have a microwave to warm them up.....hmmmm what. First off a microwave wouldn't be an appropriate thing to tell a customer and I think they should have explained they are served cold as she stated a lot of previous customers had complained about it. She even told me about another restaurant down the street that served them hot. I didn't eat another bit and unfortunately she said she couldn't take them off the tab. The rest of the food was okay but I've honestly had better at other Greek places in ton. They serve big portions and my friend said her chicken Kabob  was very good. So overall three stars for being average

cbpV6Hsm8DzYOVgtRUSSNQ.text: Yanni's is AMAZING. I've always thought Yassou's was the best there was in vegas- I almost didn't even try this. But I'm here to say- step aside Yassou! This place is incredible and dangerously close to home. Chicken gyro pita with garlic & feta fries- amaze balls. I will be back! (Will update my review as I try more menu items)

pOqmU-VW_t6l3_BTNl2mfQ.text: GARLIC FETA FRIES  I tried this place out becuase i was craving some Greek salad. I had to give it a 4 star becuase i was a bit disappointed with the dressing on the salad. It was not vinegretty at all.. it was like pure oil and a little spicy hint to it which I did not expect at all.  The salad itself look beautiful and tasteful but it just wasn't what it looked like.  On the other hand... the garlic feta fries were freaken DERICIOUS! They were juicy fries with lots of garlic flavor and soft feta cheese sprinkled all over. Also got the hummus appetizer which was also a little bland for my taste and not enough citrus. But they did give a lot of pita bread with it!  Baklava was absolutely delicious and you could see the pure honey on it and every bite had some crunch to it from the nuts.  Overall I would definately be back for the garlic fries and probably the salad but bring my own dressing.

g1MccvAxfGWl1LeYyNTo5g.text: We're first timers here so my husband and I were pretty excited to try it and it's great that it's so close to where we live! I ordered the chicken shawarma plate which comes with salad, pita, rice pilaf and really tasty chicken! My husband ordered the traditional (lamb and beef) pita and garlic feta fries!       We ordered to go but the staff was really friendly and explained how the menu works. Everything was clean and the interior is simple but works with the cuisine. First off the portions are huge! And even in the to go box the presentation was nice and appetizing! Everything is basically just super tasty and fresh! This new venture was so worth it and I'm happy! We're definitely going to come back and hopefully try the baklava!

oLyj7juEga_NpHMRBW-nKw.text: Garlic frys to die for! I've also tried the chicken schwarma plate and the lamb gyro and both were very good and large portions. This place is located across from Southpoint Casino and it's kind of a hidden gem. It has a family owned feel and the workers are very nice. The menu is pretty simple, and the price range is about $7-12. It's quality food so I don't mind spending the extra $ and skip out on cheap take-out. If you have a craving for Greek food in Las Vegas, this is the place to go!

They seem to do good business with the South Point visitors coming from across the way. The environment is definitely casual-to-austere. The lamb was very tasty, I must say.

GS8mtYH8Hlp9SEXTk_J_pA.text: Came here for dinner.  We both ordered steak kabobs and they were good, as was the rice that came with.  I ordered a lamb skewer but it didn't come.  I did not ask again because there was plenty to eat with the kabob order, I was full enough.  Service was good.  Not very expensive, so I will be back when I'm craving g Greek.

7DZu93A_mFwgR_cs3YlXOQ.text: Came across this place from a Yelp search something must be up with all of the 5 start ratings! Unassuming from they storefront but don't let that fool you. Once inside cozy ambiance with couch seating and a stage setup for live entertainment. But what about the food you ask? It'a awesome well prepared fresh made. I had the gyro and ordered their Feta Fries and I added a small Greek salad. Gyro tasted great what you would expect with all those Greek flavors, pita bread soft ingredients inside tasted like they cut it to order. Feta Fries great flavor they smelled killer and taste the same must try. Finally the in-house made baklava crisp and not too sweet perfect! I wanted to get coffee with but they dump their coffee at 7:00 one hour before close oh well lol! Parking easy staff very friendly. Too bad it not near where I live but now I know where to go for great affordable Greek chow!

Just like we remembered it if not better! Their portions are amazing! I always get the platter with half gyro meat and half chicken because I can never make up my mind with which I like better. PCdC1-BaXn3ss3Dpm7u0jg.text: The first time i ordered from Yanni's it was very delicious.  I ordered the chicken shawarma plate with the Greek salad and it was soo much food. It came with lots of juicy chicken with this amazing sauce on top And on the side, the rice was perfectly cooked , warm pita bread wrapped in aluminum foil and a side Greek salad. Everything was so good i decided to go back a couple days later and order the grilled Athenian chicken plate. I heard so much about the garlic feta fries so i substituted the salad for the fries and requested extra amazing sauce. I was so disappointed this time around. The chicken was very very dry and the rice was hard and sitting in a pool of oil. The fries tasted old but had good flavor. I didn't get any pita bread or extra sauce which were my favorite parts of the meal before.. maybe because i got the fries instead of the salad. Needless to say the second time wasn't a charm but I'll still give it another try. I'll just go back to the original order and see how that goes.

5oryVUhRgydUTMJMMjPaAA.text: This place literally has the best Greek food in the entire city. The customer service is on point, prices are reasonable, and the food is terrific. The tall, young gentleman was a pleasure to talk with and he was very friendly. Last week I tried the Greek Salad since I started the Keto diet, and the Greek Salad is Keto friendly which makes me want to eat lunch here everyday now   The only negative thing I would say is the last few times I checked in, I never got my discount. S-hMjn1povypM7EtJUHA7Q.text: I've been here multiple times and each meal has been very good. I usually get the shawarma plate with rice, my wife gets the chicken shawarma with fries, my daughter gets the chicken shawarma with fries, my youngest daughter gets the chicken dinner, and my son gets the french fries. My wife tried the garlic fries before and definitely prefers regular fries. The food here is always good. The lady behind the counter is always very kind to our family and always takes good care of us. The portions are big and very filling. You will not leave this place hungry. If you want to eat really good Greek food; enjoy a great atmosphere; and be taken care of by an attentive hostess who will answer all your questions then come here to support an awesome local business. I had to post this review since this place is so damn good.

oeTudkVaROxiECGvXoU_mA.text: I enjoyed eating here with my family. Food is fresh, a very authentic flavor. Warm environment, very homey and yummy

3SnOmXpYHlYKH6WcCj4JMw.text: I've had Yanni's on my bookmarks list for ages now.   I finally stopped in today, as I was craving a gyro salad in the WORST way.  When I popped in, I asked the lovely lady who helped me if they were the same folks who used to own the Greek Village Cafe years ago.  She said the previous owners were, which made me a little sad.  I knew Yanni from dance events we used to have at the Greek Village about 10 years ago, and was hoping to say hello.  I knew he used to own this shop as I ran into him at the tattoo parlor next door.  Anyway, previous owners aside, today I ordered a gyro salad and a side of garlic feta fries.  Believe, me you need these in your life.  I took it to go, and drove the 15ish minutes back to work.  My fries were still hot!  Woo hoo!  So let me tell you, the fries are amazing.  Perfect texture, with crumbly feta and something that gives them a little spice, they're served with a creamy sauce that is incredible.  I devoured this.    My gyro salad was perfect.  Kalmatta olives without the pits, crunch lettuce, feta, and perfect gyro meat, I completely stuffed myself finishing.  (came with tomato, as well, but I hate tomato, so I just pulled it off.  I always forget to ask to hold the tomato.)   I will absolutely be back, and soon.  Everything was delicious, and I'd like to try out more on the menu!!

My sandwich came fast and it veggies takes really fresh. The lamb was perfectly cooked and juicy. Also the tzaiki sauce was really good, I wish it was more evenly spread out on the sandwich- it was heavy on the front but none in the back. I'd try this place again, good for lunch

nxHInpR-Q0vqd3PKUBM0Ww.text: Delicious! They gave us the wrong fries though which I should have checked before leaving. I didn't like them as they had hummus on them but my husband said they were the best fries he's ever had!

jKJNbluB8Cs-aOrt6Sa8Uw.text: We were looking for a place to eat close to our hotel. Somehow, a wrong turn took us here. I'm glad it did.   Very warm family run business. Decor reminds me of why I need to go back to Greece real soon.   They don't have the typical Greek cuisine since they're more the Americanized Greek fast food restaurant but that's ok. Their food was still real good.   I had the lamb gyro w everything and finished it all. This doesn't usually happen but it was perfect size to satisfy and fill my hungry tummy.   The little egg rolls like appetizers were soooooo good. I could have just eaten those for dinner. We tried both spinach and the ones with spinach and chicken. Both had feta and were really delicious.   We had a few sides. Very pleased with all we ordered. The waitress offered us dessert but we were so full. I I'll need to have the baklava next time we come here.

yLbrzXK8HisO01I-zqKPww.text: Was in the area and was looking for something that might please the palate saw Yanni's Greek Grill, I really like going and supporting small businesses so this was the place . Walked into this small little restaurant with mostly table seating and a lounge area clean little place ,promptly seated given a menu with  good selections we ordered .  A Shawarma Platter for $11.99 and a Gyro Combo for $11.25 .  The platter came with Orzo Rice Pilaf, Small Greek Salad , and Pita Bread , starting with the salad it was fresh and crisp with a good Greek Salad dressing served with slightly grill pita that was crisp but soft in the inside we also had a order of hummus at the table which was Delicious ! The Shawarma a mixture of beef and lamb served on top of the rice was good but I noticed it was chopped and not shaved so you know I asked and the I believe the owner/ chef told me she prefer to serve it that way easier to chew well ok good nevertheless . Now the Chicken Gyro was good with the Tahini sauce to us it had a different taste not what we're used to it was kind of sweet but it was alright served with hummus which I already stated was good . All in all it was a good meal .  This is a nice little restaurant which has good Mediterranean Cuisine, Good service , Clean inside and Good food a must try ,and remember support your Local Small Businesses when in the area we will definitely come again !

dWvGi6kPuOTctzOYH8WxmA.text: One word describes this place - FRESH!  Everything is fresh and flavorful. Hummus is outstanding - they make it fresh inhouse.  We had the greek salad and chicken kabobs.   Their Greek Dressing is flavorful,  but not overpowering. Chicken was very moist and had an excellent flavor.  Give this place a try - you will be glad you did.

I ordered lamb kabob, chicken kabob, garlic fries and kotopita (chicken, feta and spinach rolls) yesterday and had to bring my brother and my husband to this place today.

aVsFFm_EjPCqr1nYB4EuJg.text: So the only reason I am giving 3 stars is we dined in thinking they would have adequate seating. Boy was I wrong. They had a tv on playing a hockey game which was so loud I couldn't pay attention to anything else.   Also, I order a chicken Greek salad and totally had a brain fart and forgot to ask for the dressing on the side. When I was finally able to track the owner down he was not super kind about the request saying that he had already made it and kinda huffing & puffing about how he would have to make a new one. I am way to big of a push over and agreed that it would be fine.   The salad was actually quite delicious and thankfully he didn't totally overdo it with the dressing but it was still a little too oily. The food alone is at least 4 starts and I might be back but only for take out and now I know to ask for the dressing on the side.   The owner did offer after the food came out to make me another one if I didn't like it, but it would have been nice to have been offered that option first.   They also have no restrooms and served my meal on a paper plate. In my opinion, it's a take out only place.

AAom2fdhZPSHk2GuGXM0Mw.text: I absolutely love Greek food & was over by the south point, I was hungry & came to look for s sandwich place & saw Yanni's I'm glad I stopped in!!! Gyro & garlic/feta fries are amazing!! I'll be back! Thank you fir the kind service too

YzB38zQiuHvLHGBlQYvm-w.text: Authentic and delicious! Quick delivery. Best part is it's consistent. Normally order for ten people at a time at work. Filet is my favorite. I'll definitely be ordering again.

0DZdKSYX6043mLE_3f0zcw.text: This place has the best gyros in Vegas and the staff is very friendly. We will definitely visit here every time we visit vegas

I1ueNLcITwSPYyWvu8NXEw.text: Called in here the other day with my family (party of 5). Between us, we had, and shared, just about everything on the menu and it was all great. Service was fine too. No alcohol though so minus one star.

btsL3GSa21E94b1LpccbHQ.text: Normally I come in but last time I did Did Uber eats. I always get the gyro platter it's awesome every time.. it's a complete meal. Always leave me satisfied. I even eat all the salad...

K8EM-Q5WV94cvfE4clfrjw.text: My fiance comes here for work lunches. He and his colleagues love it. The service is great and the food is AMAZING. No complaints at all. Plenty of parking and a very convenience location. This has to be the go-to Greek food spot.

GKXjfqKSWdWMgnb7Ket7Rw.text: I kept passing by Yanni's Greek Grill for awhile before I decided to go inside and try out their food. Yanni's is small, housed behind the Del Taco and it's possible to miss seeing the sign if you're not looking for it sometimes, but it's there and it is worth eating there. The first time I ordered from there, I got the chicken shawarma platter (all platters include orzo rice pilaf, small Greek salad, and pita bread). The people behind the counter were friendly and my take-out food arrived quickly. I took my food home and ate the most delicious Greek food I've had in a really long time. I was also surprised by how filling the platter was, so much so that I was full the rest of the day.  I've also ordered the combo value meal with shawarma and a side dish of garlic feta fries. The food, especially the fries, blew my mind. The value meal also is enough food to keep me full the rest of the day, so unless you're a bottomless pit, I don't suggest getting some Yanni's late in the day.  I keep going back to Yanni's Greek Grill because the food is amazing and I'm satisfied with their customer service. I've never eaten in, as I'm usually too busy to, but while there isn't a public restroom, there Yanni's are friendly folk who make you feel at home, something I've witnessed time and time again while I waited for my food and other people were eating in. If you're in the area, definitely stop by Yanni's Greek Grill. I know I'm probably already there. ;)

mngKJA16ohIptA1JJVpz6g.text: Every time I get urge for Greek food, I come here because it's close to me.  Last time, when I ordered through Yelp, there was some confusion and my order wasn't in. So I recommend calling instead.  Love their salad, gyro and chicken shawarma platter. The salad is always fresh and the gyro and chicken shawarma are nice and flavorful.  I always order take out. I wish they have more seating area.

Dm964ay28_Fo3T4_wMcM3Q.text: Wandered in to this place while staying nearby. Amazing! I ate here three times in two days.  STRONGLY recommend the schwarma plates.  Both are delicious and the rice was yummy. Also tried the hummus and pita appetizer, soooo good.  Had spanakopita, I didn't like it, but I could tell the ingredients were fresh and the food was high quality, just wasn't my thing. Had the gyro and garlic fries.  The gyro was huge and messy (as it should be).   Based on other Yelp reviews, I added a side of sauce, probably that's a good idea if you like a lot of sauce.  The garlic fries were incredible.   Each time I came in, the staff was polite and accommodating. Highly recommend!!!

V1fgmVlaCSjXsMJNQf06-g.text: Garlic feta fries are tops! The best chicken shawarma I've ever had. Fresh Greek salad and like everything we tasted the spices are perfectly balanced.

QcGud2nYaHsGDQtGLqLy2w.text: I haven't had Greek food before and I tried this place for the first time. I had a late lunch and it was pretty busy when I came in so it has to be good. I ordered the traditional Greek pita that was suggested but the Owner named Mike and I also got the garlic feta fries and it was amazing and the customer service just as great I will definitely come back again! The food taste very authentic and everyone was super nice and polite
