mcCuZBTkii94dcns57TC9A.text: Yes this place is great!  Yummy gyro's and a different type of spinach pie.  The spanakopita is served rolled up in thin, crispy philo dough like a spring roll.  The owner is a friendly older Greek man and the servers are all so nice and friendly.  Not the cheapest but definitely huge portions and tasty food.  Their gyro salad fits in my low carb diet so I get a carry out usually once a week.  This is my favorite Mediterranean restaurant in Vegas.  They have since expanded their dining area and doubled the space.

Jk84XGzOkNPUre4BpnjbuQ.text: Yanni's Greek Grill is solid food in a small but clean restaurant. Came in for a gyro, walked out with a massive one PLUS a bowl of avgolemono soup for $13. There are no public bathrooms here, kind of a takeout only sort of spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giant baklava $3.25
Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Funny

-qT9wB8dHZGULX_AshcXPQ.text: My boyfriend and I found this place while vacationing in Vegas. He loved the gyro  and I ordered chicken kebab and garlic fries. Food was fresh and the service was great. Owner friendly, I give it five stars and recommend Highly.

e2faZabcNAlm8wNZGnvWCA.text: Found this little Greek spot on a whim and it was amazing!  The portions are huge, and if you love gyros these are the best I've had!  Great service and reasonable prices.  Definitely try the babaganoush and garlic fries.  We will be back for sure.

AiLo4-Vbjeu6KzhQjbSLJA.text: This place never disappoints. Food is amazing and service is always awesome. Highly recommend this place. Yum!!

2QZjz40MfwTU6861UwKPmA.text: These people are actually Greek. You have to have the garlic feta fries! The meats are cooked to perfection. Gyros and salads are excellent. Very fast and friendly service. Highly recommend this place for your Greek cuisine needs.

S5um2hbzJUKykHq71H3-NQ.text: The garlic feta fries are blessed by the Greek gods!!! So good!!! I'd add a photo but we devoured them!!!!

DupQ_Cb3oTHKsEm4-LYjzg.text: Seriously the best Greek food in Vegas!!! And to top it off... The owner is the coolest guy ever!

cblWkJOepddjbMgetgMn-Q.text: Fast and healthy! LOVE the chicken gyro! ! ! All white meat it is so flavorful the garlic feta fries are great as well. Customer service is great as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken gyro and garlic feta fries

r7SZ9IqaZidcxllnXSUn6Q.text: Probably had Greek food maybe twice in my life so I thought I'd give it another shot since its in the neighborhood. Got the regular gyro and garlic fries combo for $12 and worth every penny. Food was fresh and there was plenty. Reading the menu while waiting for to go order, I'll be ordering the steak skewers next time. The garlic fries were definitely a hit with me.

Nu0tbWklcUXz_CID37MyUA.text: Got tired of Mexican and Asian food so I wanted to try something that I haven't tried in a long long time: Greek food. I found this little restaurant on yelp and after reading the reviews and looking at the photos Yanni's didn't disappoint! I ordered the chicken gyro with garlic feta cheese fries and it was delicious! The food portions were large and it will leave you full! I definitely will be back and I recommend it!

7wL2QCd0LD-9T_wHrAQ21w.text: Amazing food, we ordered family style, a few apps and the gyros were just so flavorful!!! Sauces are authentic and tasty! The owner is very friendly and served our family with a smile on his face. Defiantly going to be a regular at Yanni's!!!

UWlnvLbF8CUWRugRKu3ivg.text: My husband and I just ordered 2 chicken gyros with the feta fries and they were great! Lots of chicken and full of flavor,we also tried the baklava it was amazing:) we will def order from here again.

DqAY5p22uFJ5dnEgRjOVRw.text: This has been if not one of the best Greek food I've had in this town in a long time. Yanni's has the best fries I've tasted in a long time!!! Also there Gyros is EPIC! As a concierge it's very important that I recommend good food, entertainment, attractions and just overall AWESOME Experience to my clients. As far as good Greek food Yanni's is the place to go!

P9fKJGLYdawOMOc6ZOZaoA.text: Visiting from Seattle and found this gem of a restaurant. Great casual Greek food and generous portions! Leftovers for lunch tomorrow, yum!

5Fnnw9Kg65X6qVLIfcgdTQ.text: Just as great as the original Yanni's Gyros! I couldn't believe my eyes when I saw this new shop was open and was even more excited when I learned the owner is the same guy that owns Yanni's Gyros. Authentic and fresh. Go Greek and support local!

PQl0VpNb5EOEwJ7BdKW4-w.text: Went here before. Food was good and the portions were generous and the service was fast and friendly

UeJuI8SnlZA3jlwOkhr_oA.text: Great place, service, and food! Largest gyro I've ever had. Awesome bang for your buck. 5 stars!

7w4amGvD36ezG8UTsZbWWg.text: I went to this restaurant going to get a Greek salad on a Saturday night at 7:20 in Las Vegas. The hours clearly stated they were open till 8 PM, however the door was locked. There was a guy in the back but he wouldn't come to the door stating they were closed. Very disappointing.

Sp4A2IcLIAHhoDtBVECV8w.text: Best greek food!! Everything from delicious Gyros, shawarmas, dolmas, crispy garlic fries, fresh greek salads and tasty pita bread. Everything was very fresh and authentic. Definitely a low key spot. Can't wait to go back!

o3HDzwChE87PJyXdlu5v_g.text: Delicious!  Just ate there for the first time. Had the chicken gyro and the garlic fries. Omg! Yum!

b4dNM10Sgap4stcz_-ngrw.text: Second time here, so tired of the attitudes of the employees, this time what appeared to the owner's son.  They serve things on cheap plastic platters.  The sauces did not seem homemade and if they were, they were oily and runny.  The grape leaves are store-bought, greasy, oily things that have sat in cans too long.  The pita is thick and tasteless, no spices and hardly heated.  The only thing that was decent was the chicken, but for $35, crappy food, attitudes, and cheap plastic, we're not going back.  There is no way this place would get anywhere close to 4.5 stars in a major metropolitan area.  Who is writing these reviews??

NSoO25w1VSfS2bX4bucmHw.text: This place is decent if you're looking for a quick bite. Yanni was friendly and there is definitely a family vibe here. Not the best food I've had, but it will do in a pinch.

ueBUXCP1UbHFhivfhCmlXQ.text: We stopped by Yanni's on our way to UT thanks grab something to eat. Got chicken kebab take out. It was delicious!! While we waited, they were very kind by giving our son free lemonade. This place will be on our list now if we come through Las Vegas area!

08MJpf2JFhljGkXwHZs81g.text: Great new lunch place find. My co-worker and I decided to try this place out after visiting the sandwich shop next door several times. We were pleasantly surprised. The place was newly remodeled and decorated in classic Greek blue. We were greeted at the door where we placed our orders. We both chose the chicken pita combo with hummus. The hummus and pita arrived shortly after we sat down. The pita seemed homemade and the hummus was delicious. Next came our sandwiches...great flavor and the chicken was cooked perfectly.  The owner and other family members made us feel welcomed and checked on us often.  The service was perfect for a quick lunch. We will definitely be back and we can't wait to try more items on the menu.

LEmQBfJ_woS5prE6lIzvGw.text: SERIOUSLY! I have been staying at South Point casino since Friday and I JUST found this place. All i can say is delicious! Service was fast and the staff was friendly. I was so sick of eating at the mediocre places inside of the hotel and am so glad I walked across the street to find this delicious greek place.  I got the COMBO plate with the Gyro and Baba ghanoush....the food was on point and well priced. I will definitely be back at least one more time before I leave this weekend.   i HIGHLY recommend!

6gGCemf-r47QRydBINalmg.text: I ordered the traditional gyro combo with garlic fries, price was $10.99 but their servings are generous. The traditional gyro was all good, soft fresh pita, tasty meat, fresh vegetables and  Greek yogurt sauce. The garlic feta fries were crispy and full of flavor with the feta and garlic sauce on them.  This place is in the strip mall on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd and Silverado Ranch, behind the Del Taco and next to Capriotti's. It has about 15-20 tables that seat 4 each. I just did a takeout order, but the place is roomy enough to handle a 20-40 people. This is my first time here, so  I will be revisiting the place and will see how they do in the long run.

N8L3i1JdAsvMC7yLiSNuNQ.text: My wife was looking for a good kebob place close to home.  I told her there wasn't one.  She said yelp it so I did.  I was wrong.  We found this place.  Foid was good and reasonably priced.  Will definitely be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

W5rEw4zCy3e8z_oLvzG62A.text: I ordered take out last night and will definitely be coming back. Glad I found this place.. Never would have known it was in that shopping complex if I hadn't googled it. Very friendly service. We ordered the gyro platter, gyro pita, spanakopita and hummus. The gyro meat was tasty and so was the tzatziki. The gyro meat on the platter had a small amount of possibly aoili drizzled on it, and I haven't had it anywhere else like that but it gave it a little more flavor. The spanakopita filling was delicious and fresh! The pastry was a little different and rolled up vs what you might find elsewhere cut into squares. I like Israeli hummus more but this hit the spot! My bf enjoyed it and said it was good and finished his meal.

wgusjB-s0-MqRsgbDzqY1g.text: Great food! Average prices. Yum!! Just across the street from South Point Casino if you're staying there.

QjKufabNmXU92vZ8I1x2lQ.text: We had the chicken gyro and garlic feta fries. So delicious.  Our waiter was friendly and attentive. We wish we lived closer so we could come here again.

ccUD48ioOo864ke2SUOB5Q.text: Don't confuse this place with the other Yannis...Trust me..not the same.  This place is sooooo much better.  Their gyros are one of the best Ive had.  Its nice little family owned restaurant.  The staff was super friendly.  The food is always good.  Tale out is fast for those days I just want to be at home.  My fiance love this place. He always orders the steak and chicken kebabs.  Highly recommend this place.

NC9VMfgefjs_Zed8xm1i6w.text: Excellent authentic food and there are large portions at a good price. Highly recommend!

0v8LSfS2_jkAA3CnyenOxw.text: Wow just came in here for the first time and am blown away, this is definitely my new goto  place to eat!  Ordered the lamb plate and Gyro pita. Oh and garlic feta fries wow those are amazballs!!

7dzDvZUF-Bc1zpVlkXGp7w.text: This place is definitely one of Las Vegas' hidden treasures. The food is authentic.  The staff is friendly. The Baklava is to die for. We will definitely keep going back.

zn3uxbWmfr0LeTIk56oHRw.text: Love this place!!!!! The best Greek food in Vegas! I would eat here every day. I usually order the Gyro Salad. Also the Greek garlic feta fries are delicious!

7Ba6XWlYdDjGM15P50NSRw.text: What a great place. We visited Yanni's while visiting Vegas for CES. Mike, the chef, greeted us and shared with us all his suggestions, which we took him up on. Fantastic Gyros with the unique suggestion of caramelized onions and the garlic feta fries were to die for. We'll be back for sure.

Y1_n3TWDMZRK18bpB-CMfQ.text: This restaurant is located in close proximity to the South Point Hotel & Casino where we were staying.   It is cozy restaurant, ultra casual and a bit on the dumpy side with most people placing orders to go though there is seating for around 10.  Neither of us were particularly hungry the evening of our visit so we each opted for traditional lamb/beef gyros.  The gyro meat, according to the restaurant's website, contains no fillers or MSG and I watched as it was sliced off a revolving spit.  The combination of gyro meat, tomatoes, lettuce, onions, and fresh pita bread combined with a flavorful tzatsiki sauce made for a delicious light dinner.

sZik_BFcsbfcE50K2p20ZA.text: the best Greek cuisine ever had The taste of the real Greek food And the size that fills you up Worth the money

1XTRUzHaIH6Q6fDGLXClKA.text: Highly recomnend!! Wow.mthis place has great food!  We had chicken kabob which came with healthy portion of great tasting rice pilaf .two skewers of tender tasty chicken.  Would be been mice to have veggies on it but the value is better..all meat.  Comes drizzled w a mild garlic sauce and a side of a yogurt sauce s n d a small Greek salad w delicious dressing.  Oh and a side of pita bread. Wish they added a small hummus...all for $12.99. Lot if food and really good.  Atmosphere is fair..it's clean ..basic..nothing fancy..but who cares when the food is great.  Server was very friendly and accomodating.

kIY6mV9fRqS7jQBhwHAr1w.text: Great place. Authentic Greek gyros. Garlic gets fries are awesome and so is the salad. Always hits the spot. Check it out...u won't be disappointed

Qjp8OYB7QMGWPuox7h8TlA.text: Clearly a neighborhood establishment, not a high end restaurant (but they don't pretend to be), the food was great, but lacked ANY kind of atmosphere. The food was fresh and very tasty, and the place was clean. The prices were very reasonable.

DOI1rTT9U5ozjLEVyi2aXw.text: I stopped by here leaving the airport upon arriving in Las Vegas. I saw this place on Yelp and I'm glad that I tried it. The greek salad was full of flavor and the shawarma was delicious.

knPEOEIzda1naqvVlBlKhw.text: Food is good but different from last time the pita didn't taste as good. The baklava was good but different then last time. The hummus was good but the pita wasn't as good.

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic feta fries

1kJL8npv16HuVLldmA6tog.text: Heading out of Vegas and wanted an inexpensive and healthy meal, trust me when I say we definitely hit the right spot. We were there pretty early, but a bunch of regulars started trickling in. That's when you know it's good food!

BtMcJ1ftcwrFsp4D_gtFNQ.text: Great Greek food and generous portions. I usually order to go and they always get the order right. Ate at restaurant one time and the service was very good. Server was very friendly and would check up on us. Definitely recommend this place.

RIJ5BNO0MhfWShzwPfbYlw.text: Amazing service with great affordable food! Manager or owner is really friendly! We tried their chicken with Athens fries and it was juicy and delicious! They also have a Greek beer!

wm5ngosWgTeDcz1uy_gO4w.text: Food was great and portions were huge.  We had the feta fries, gyro platter, grilled athenian chicken platter, and the kopita spring rolls.  All of it was good,  no complaints here

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Feta fries, Gyro platter, Kopita Spring Rolls

Tc7UDZituhcxWj-vNOvDXg.text: Loved the lamb kabobs. Rice w/orzo. Would have been nice if the pita bread came with humus.  Good portion size especially the salad.   Prices very reasonable.

LtPeH987rg6n1VI4hm6Vkw.text: Found restaurant on Yelp and wasn't disappointed. The service was great, our server was friendly and informative. The restaurant was clean and the food was delicious. Will definitely stop in again next time I'm in the area.

f2q_rhUGvZ0cfFZlRXtrOw.text: I'm from the Mediterranean. I grew up eating Mediterranean food. I know what authentic Greek food should taste like, and most 'Greek' restaurants are anything but authentic. Everything is cheaply made in a hurry, awful quality ingredient and simply depressing. But, this! Mmm... I still have the flavor of the filet mignon kebob in my mouth from a week ago. The gyros, shawarma, falafel, dolmades and salad all are amazing. Just like eating at home. You really can tell when a cook puts in the effort, it simply tastes different and it's so good. Even, when I can't go in person, I Ubereats it. Oh and the olive oil/vinegar sauce.... It's literally orgasmic. Drizzle it on everything. Haha. The pita is always fresh, warm and soft, just like it's supposed to be. The fries are awesome too, especially with feta and herbs, but do yourself a favor and have an entree with a few sides instead.

b6XwDvjVK1UPHIc-uxAaqQ.text: I reviewed Yanni's before but I felt compelled to review it again. They deserve your business. Hands down best Gyros I've had in Vegas and in the Top 10 that I've had nationwide. So stop searching for a place to eat and go there now! Also, don't forget to order the baklava as well.

xUnDGtz7w-N60-1TAkAizA.text: I am so glad we decided to stop here for dinner. I had the chicken shish kabob and my boy friend got the filet mignon.  The salad was huge.  The pita bread was soft.  The meat was so juicy and flavorful.  I am coming back! WE ARE SATISFIED. The ppl were awesome and nice

rFFgXPEu6iTuT4vKoCmBug.text: THE BEST shawarma I have ever had! We have tried several Mediterranean places around town, and this is our new favorite. Keep it up!!!

A6rp62kKNCbIEXC7xzHsAw.text: I feel so bad for Amber (the younger girl) working here. The older lady is bossy and rude to her in front of patrons.   I came in for an UberEATS delivery pick up and had to wait over 40 minutes for it. The entire time Amber was being bossed around and talked down to by the older lady.

ufzCIEnsa1Gf6BFDVakVxw.text: This place is AMAZING!!! I never get disappointed! Anett is such a sweetheart and gave us phenomenal service!

KuQvIVMi0KbidvZtPDk7yQ.text: This is by far the best Greek food in Las Vegas. Everything is so fresh and yummy. The baklava is melt in your mouth delicious, sweet & a hint of cinnamon. The service is wonderful, every time I go I am waited on by a sweet lady who is very accommodating. I highly recommend this restaurant.

kwdZ3-7u4w4ToqX3xhb5IQ.text: I first went to the Yannis on Silverado ranch.  It was perfect. I'm sure I wrote a review already.. this location was closer to my house. I didn't know they were connected. I think sisters own the two restaurants. So they both have their own flair on certain recipes. Everything is very similar and consistent. This restaurant is bigger on the inside. But we too our food to go. Everything was pretty quick. A lot of people take their orders to go. Big portions and again.. fries to die for. We will definitely be back. Prices are decent. :)

jcCvTPavnC1yHugqnusJHg.text: This greek restaurant is LEGIT, its a hidden gem here in Las Vegas. Its a small restaurant, but it's not usually packed. (Im surprised it isnt knowing their food is amazing, but then again I came here around 2-3pm)  I had lamb chops which was really soft, usually lamb chops ive tried here in Vegas are chewy (because its not fresh), but theirs was really good. Top it off with some garlic feta fries, i have no idea how they "marinade" it but its super good. Service is great, too.  While I'm writing this I asked my husband to drive over there and get me some garlic feta fries just cuz i was craving for it :P

Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Feta Fries... Amazing creation! Bless you guys lol

NbTS-R7qS9f07rmuNDJ7bw.text: The food was amazing so fresh , flavorful and authentic! We accidentally stumbled upon this little place , Soso happy we did. We were in Vegas 4 days spent so much money and this was honestly the best food we had all weekend!  Definitely take the drive and go check it out(get the garlic garlic feta fries)

bsqPHEBQZ56sqQiuAsvcvQ.text: I ordered for pickup with the yelp app. It worked great. The food was ready when I arrived. I enjoyed my chicken kabobs with rice and a salad. Tasty and not dried out! I would order food from here again.

AenboLbnkhTKIF6yuH6KKw.text: I've gone here a couple times and it NEVER disappoints. I love gyros and baklava. I tried the shawarma for the first time and that was great too. I suggest the garlic feta fries, so yummy. Definitely the best greek food i've had here in town.

1TB51Vg2ITfrXxmOiP6hxQ.text: Went here today for take-out. The food here is really good! The lady at the front was super friendly and helpful, told her it was my first time there and she explained the menu to me and recommended some of their most popular items.  Ended up getting the Gyro platter which comes with the meat, Greek salad with light oil dressing, and rice pilaf. The meat is so good! Perfectly seasoned, not too salty. The rice pilaf is a mix of rice and orzo pasta, must of been cooked in some type of broth because it smelled and tasted so good! Th salad has olives, onions, cucumber, tomatoes and feta cheese on top, very good!  Also got an order of feta garlic fries... Oh my god .. Garlicky goodness. The fries are so crispy, very strong garlic flavors which I love, the sauce that comes with the fries is so good! Will definitely come back for more!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro platter
Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Feta garlic fries

eQn07Zczp9-Ck-H88vtbbQ.text: Food is flavor-full and well done, but alway seem to run into problems getting the order right on the first try.

FANUSm31_iMww43x1p1L9g.text: What a gem this place is for anyone looking for excellent Greek food. Clean, great service, and great prices. If anyone is staying at South Point, go across the street behind the Shell station and visit this place.   I am certain the next time I am in town, I will need to make reservations well in advance.

E8k47Thf_8_h-3XYxzSaSw.text: Without question, my favorite Greek restaurant EVER! Yanni's dolmas (grape leaves) are the best I've ever had! The Gyros and salads are hugely, uh ample. Let's just say it's enough for two meals. This family-owned restaurant is a gem. They are so very nice, caring and considerate. I loved what they did with the remodel. Highly recommended for excellent food and service!

gmU_ioKE4rSVT4E1U2o7XQ.text: First time eating Greek food and it was delicious! I had the chicken gyro salad and my boyfriend had the sharama plate- both were pretty flavorful and fulfilling. We also tried the garlic-feta fries and they were superb! I didn't realize feta cheese and garlic was such a great combination!! Additionally, the service was great and the waitress was friendly and super helpful in explaining what each item was. I will definitely visit again soon. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bxurrVRmy9bnHHeUtEa6BQ.text: I was at my friend's house last night, and we decided to order from here. We all had the gyro platter. OMG...so good! I ate the whole thing. The gyro meat was juicy and tender. Spiced just right. The rice was great, too. The put a little secret sauce on the meat, and whatever it was, it was a perfect fit. I can't wait to eat here again!

G6Bv0CyDUNPvaXU6a0JDwQ.text: A great place to eat, but could use a more friendly customer service.  The food is spicier than at other Greek places in the valley, which is surprising.  Overall, a clean place with quick service.

SF4VDGY8phzy9eaWFZS7Zw.text: Visiting the area, we were in the mood for something fresh and delicious. We browsed Yelp and found Yanni's Greek Grill. What a treat!   We ate in the dining room and our server was very personable and she gave great recommendations. We enjoyed: Dolmodes, Chicken Shawarma, Greek salad, and Gyro Pita, and complimentary pita. It was all so delicious! I was thrilled to have leftovers to take home to enjoy the next day. We're planning to go back again very soon as we keep talking about how great of a meal it was.

yIx9qGzjJZVxbl7HsHn49w.text: The food was delicious: the garlic feta fries were crispy and flavorful. The salad was super fresh. The gyro sandwich was a really good portion and for a good price. The service was friendly and efficient. Overall a great experience, I would highly recommend Yanni's!

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

am7Dkpu9NV3uKF7e_9bZQw.text: I think they were going through some remodeling when I went because the seating area looked like it needed some TLC and they didn't have ice water so I had to purchase bottled water. At Yanni's, you order at the register, pay, and then they bring out your food.   I had the gyro Greek salad and was not impressed at all. Usually, I love these at any Greek or Mediterranean restaurant but here the gyro meat was way too oily and the greens were kind old old looking and super bitter. It seems like they get really good reviews so I will give them another chance. My salad also came with grilled pita bread. I though it was funny that the only hot sauce they had was Asian Chili sauce... Lol   The service was great... The cashier was very friendly and kept checking up on me and so did the owner/chef.

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yHBP4AH_5j02_8F6nqyz_Q.text: Excellent gyro! The blend they have is perfect taste. We had the feta fries and the eggplant was phenomenal. Hummus is great and we had the feta egg rolls. Glad we found this spot because we were headed to mad Greek and they have less stars.

XiCqZFMvO7K6qN8V6h6mIw.text: Lunch with the family. Table for eight and it was ready in an instant. Very fast and friendly service. Started with garlic feta fries. Absolutely delicious.  Everyone in the party ordered different entrees but everyone was pleased with what they ordered. This place will be getting our repeat business for sure!!!

M33FN3L2N6uUHS9TRab9pA.text: Take out Greek food it's really good. When you're in the mood for a gyro or good Greek pastries this is your place .Good service.

8OuZ0uKafHFR9ok9D7VdYQ.text: Their chicken shawarma platter is the best in Las Vegas! The hummus is so garlicy and amazing, and the pita bread is almost always fresh and hot! I definitely recommend this place to everyone.

XJI8S4FL7D5MHof00bEvmw.text: Awesome but a little on the costly side. But well worth it. Salads are to die for. Kabobs, gyros exceptionally great. Could eat here every night if possible.

f5EZq_0dv-aKQ30VeGN7eg.text: I decided to order a combo special with a gyro and garlic feta fries. Unfortunately I had a buffet for breakfast and hadn't fully recovered enough to finish this delicious meal. They give you a LOT of fries.   There was so much meat on the gyro that I had trouble figuring out how to bite into it as there was no way to get my mouth around the whole sandwich.   Flavor was great. Presentation was nice. Serving size was generous. Prices were higher than I would have liked, but they were still in line with the market.

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro and garlic feta fries combo

CxFKXKoO4emYYbsEuJJ3Sg.text: My bro and I have been here once and we enjoyed the food. We're back and the food is as good as we remember. The workers are always nice as well. Def recommend this place if you wanna try Greek food.

61quzylCZJszCslcqQXe8Q.text: Excellent service.  Food was amazing.   The staff treated you like family. Very enjoyable experience.

hvvdZ_uTbs2wrHnBVN2J-w.text: I am giving this place 3 stars because the lady serving us was nice and because the place was clean. I am very picky with my Greek food and since there aren't many good places in Vegas to pick from, I always stick to the same 2 places I know. However, based on the great reviews, I decided to give this place a chance and try something new. Upon entering, we noticed the place was completely empty. We were told we could sit anywhere and we did so. The server comes and takes our order. We ordered their hummus as appetizer as well as their dolmades. As our main course, my husband ordered their filet mignon kebob plate, and I ordered the chicken kebob plate. The plates come with a side salad and with rice. The hummus was good (not the best I've had). The dolmades were very good! The meat was what made me give this review such low stars. It was completely flavorless!! I am not sure why that is, because any time I've had Greek food, it is loaded with flavor. That wasn't the case, unfortunately, and this is why we will not be returning. I was super disappointed because of the great reviews and because of the appetizers, which  weren't bad. I made this review so that perhaps the owners could consider my comments. They have a great location and I feel as though this is a problem that could be rectified very easily.

c_cf5xU7l87MakCL1VgVjQ.text: OMG. SOOOOOO GOOD AND FRESH. Have to try this place. Salad is fresh and the dressing is amazing. Garlic feta fries are the best I have ever had and I have had good ones but these ones are the best. Hummus was so flavorful but original I don't know how to explain it but it's excellent. Tzatziki sauce omg just as amazing. Main dishes amazing too. Idk but everytime I come back to Vegas I will be stopping in. Great job keep it up please don't change a thing. Portions honestly even if your hangry u set. Coukd share and be stuffed.

Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken shawarma amazing
Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pita and hummus soopoo good

9zy8P0dWx8ChKtGExbcVow.text: First time I had Greek food in Vegas. Food was delicious. Service was excellent. Very friendly staff. Will be coming back for more

GUV6qIoLS0YoNaY4TpRL9g.text: I thought I'd get tired of eating this nearly every day, still hasn't happened. Healthy and delicious.

ttbnKO3jFuUjH1pQr7lquw.text: Love LOVE LOVE this place! Not only are the people so welcoming but the food is absolutely amazing. Granted, I order the same things all the time, it always hits the spot and is really delicious! One week I was going everyday to get my fix. A must try is their garlic fries and chicken schwarma plate. You're welcome. Lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken schwarma. Double YES.
Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic fries. YES.

Cb-6BFZ07WSj1UMrwIBXzg.text: Perfect stop. Great service and very kind. Food was amazing. Our group had salads,  gyros and kabobs. All were great and don't miss the garlic fries

yCWX00YTI88CHrDpxJrRBg.text: My Wife and I live right down the street and we were craving Greek food and we found the best Greek spot of Las Vegas.  Being first timers here, this place is outstanding. Right when you walk-in the staff are very welcoming and also helpful. The menu is simple,well organized, and descriptive. What else is that the food is delicious. I ordered the shawarma value combo with the choice of garlic feta fries and it amazing. I would recommend this place then any other Greek spot

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef and Lamb Shawarma with the choice of Garlic Feta Fries

KWF9aLrOpMbxrgqSAus86w.text: This is literally the best Greek restaurant in the world as of now! Why..... Because they offer exquisite service, food and an overall unforgettable experience! I honestly felt like I was in Greece eating my meal!! PEOPLE YOU NEED TO TRY THIS PLACE OUT! I guarantee you won't be displeased! Gods greatest creation was Yannis Greek grill!!

CYlL8ir6e51oCF60Q93Sug.text: It was the first time trying this place.  It is simply good, the food was above average but not outstanding.  The staff were very friendly and nice.  I will come back!

1SpOBdFEI1J08RIHzBp1yg.text: Love Yanni's Greek Grill! I've been going to his place when he had the location over at Silverado and Maryland but didn't realize that he sold it 2 years ago until today.   So excited to find him over at this new location. I've been wondering why I never see Yanni for a couple years now.   Always have loved his food. Fresh ingredient and just yum!!

csjKpraql3CjVtPMzkzPVQ.text: So delicious! The tzatziki is perfect for the gyros. Delicious stuffed grape leaves, and scrumptious crispy fries.  Huge portions and great service! A little mom and pop shop that's located near capriottis and I wish it wasn't because I feel people get drawn to the capriotti name and miss this gem!

CeWvG8S-ifULdaVYxzbVjw.text: Not 4.5 stars good but good. The hummus and falafel were ok.  Chicken shawarma was not from a vertical spit like all of the other shawarma I have ever had. It was little chunks of chicken with seasoning fried on a flat top. The service was ok but seemed like everyone one there were regulars. In my opinion this made the service or allowed the service to be too relaxed. Overall, I will come back if I cannot find another Greek place eat.

94tu6MUZYRGw3gsanARXFQ.text: This place is awesome!  We ate here twice during our stay in Vegas.  Salad, gyros, humus and kebabs all got great reviews from my family. I have celiac disease and Greek food is usually a pretty safe bet for me, so I was a little disappointed that the rice had orzo pasta in it.  My husband said it tasted great though. Aside from that everything was so amazing!

su8beoTR4iaLT3GIQBrrWg.text: Bang for your buck this place has a good amount of food for your value. My boyfriend and I did not go home hungry. The flavor of the food is solid and on a tasty scale it deserves a solid 4/5.   The only reason why I give this place a 3 is the inconsistency in my salad. It had a very generous helping of chicken but the veggie ratio of cucumber vs lettuce was significantly off. The menu also had a product called garlic greek fries but the outcome was more like greek buffalo fries instead. On the other habd my boyfriend loved his gyro.   I'd come back for a 2nd shot and we'll see goes.

YbRSArVDrc_bYScHmVffjg.text: Great Greek food in a non-descript strip mall. Greek salad with gyro and a freshly made pita was refreshing on a hot July day! My husband had the Gyro sandwich and said it was very good!! Friendly staff and owner. Try it!!

kxbiAMHaqXl73kGnJUo6Ow.text: Awesome food and a really nice family that runs the place! Classic gyro and garlic fries are really good.

JywZXLqBwzvwVYaFgowZcg.text: My husband and I were nearby for an event at the South Point and we didn't feel like dealing with the crowd there.   We came across Yannis on Yelp and decided to try it out, and I am so glad we did! The food was fresh and delicious! We both had Gyros and those were delicious. We also had the garlic feta fries and those were awesome! Definitely a great place to take care of that Greek food craving!

mU0ireQbjmzDxZckGWiL_Q.text: Came in for dinner right before closing but they seated me anyway. I ordered the traditional gyro combo, and it was really good. Fresh veggies, great seasoning on the meat, tasty sauce. I could bathe in the garlic feta fries; they are really really good. Nice little restaurant off the main drag. Would eat there again the next time I'm in the area.

Aiy0SoDY5fET9e9t_--nZQ.text: Really well made traditional greek foods. Made fresh in house. If you like Greek food check this place put. They do a large carryout business and the prices are very reasonable

Pozi7HykNVBiA1zVoRMuLQ.text: This place is solid. We've been 3 times now. I always get the gyro, my wife the gyro plate, and my son the beef kabob plate. Everything  is very good. They load up the gyro pita/sandwich with meat. The rice with the plates is very good as well, they also come with a nice mini Greek side salad. I always get the garlic fets fries, they're good but need a touch additional seasoning (salt). Friendly staff. They make it fresh so it takes maybe 10 min but worth it. Tables are kinda small so large party's take note.   I'm a huge fan of gyros, this is a close second place to the best in town and I've been here nearly 20 years.   Maybe a touch over priced, I was tempted to go to 4 stars because of that but nice staff, fresh ingredients, and nice meaty portions made up for it. Definitely worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro sandwich, gyro plate, beef kabob plate, 2 Greek side salads, garlic feta fries...

b_r-ByuT_hj43tbz9tn3Bw.text: Great pit stop on our trip out to Zion and Bryce! Delicious falafel and traditional gyro and super tasty tsaziki and tahini.  Super fresh, homemade pita bread! Can't go wrong..

-oQEXA4dFtcNCFKGImkHEw.text: We are visiting from San Diego. I found this place because we were driving and searching the area for nearby healthy choices and preferably not a corporate chain.  I'm glad we stopped.  We will be back before we leave.  This is a nice family style casual restaurant with excellent food.  I guessed it would be 4.5 or 5 stars before I checked on yelp.  Sure enough 4.5.  Stop in and support this family owned restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Yanni's Greek Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great menu

DLOcUVAPNaLKBCRQYQO7Lw.text: BOMB.com! Got the gyro salad and it was amazing! Hummus was excited as well. Can't wait to go back again

asQtruNyCox8hdrC0E0rIg.text: Great service,  the woman taking my order was beyond nice. Amazing food, totally worth the prices.

Pkn3VyE16Kiei2H9q_b6Eg.text: Best gyro!!!  Got take out when visiting Las Vegas, it was close to our time share. The gyros, lamb and beef were ready in 10 minutes. Absolutely amazing!!  Flavorful, juicy and delicious. Definitely the right choice.

N8osWUNIFTSuAKpozITbXQ.text: Tho the food was pretty good I have to give this place a 3 because the gentlemen who I was making a delivery order with on the phone was not very good. It seemed like I was inconveniencing  him to delivery food to me. If you don't want to delivery then don't post that you do. I can order from other places around town. Like I said the food is pretty good but the hospitality side left a bad taste in my mouth.

hXcKvqsOT5cni9rjSaHJTA.text: A gyro combo costs $10.95, and comes with one side.  We ordered 3 gyro combos, all with garlic feta fries and a hummus/pita app.  Damn.  Delicious.  The place only has a 4 or 5 tables, and there's no bathroom on site (advertised).So if you're looking for something fancy, definitely not it.  But the food is on-point.  The hummus app only came with one pita cut in slices, and additional pitas were another .50 cents, but I just saved the hummus for the fries.   Seriously, the food is great here.  And I don't speak Greek, but I think the employees were talking to each in it, which gives it some authenticity.  Also, the drinks are served by the can, which cost a dollar.  Kinda sucks for those dining-in, but the perfect place for take-out.

m6JE2-pw0__SECGa7eQdAw.text: The owner was very nice but the place had no seating and my salad was extremely bitter. They only had 3 tables. The kicthen was so huge though. Maybe it was previously like that and didn't want to put the money Into the place. The salad was not fresh and I was very disappointed. It looked like it came out of one of those salad bags. The cucumbers were bitter and the tomatoes were very bland. I don't even think there was even dressing. The pita bread was good and the meat was but wouldn't go back. The reason I have 2 stars is because the owner is nice but they need fresh ingredients.

ejejHHtBELGetXT4dbXr5g.text: I was really looking forward to enjoying this place with all the great reviews. We were extremely disappointed. One of those rare occasions I forgot my cell phone or I could have posted pictures to explain why. I ordered a vegetarian plate with hummus, baba & falafel. The hummus was form fitted to the section in the plate just like jello pudding cups, was this plated in the morning for my 7:30 pm visit? Not what I expect when they post a sign on the counter that they don't have specials because they don't use (have?) leftovers. Really wish I'd had my phone to take a picture. Baba was not as form fitted, but both were covered in a clear oil, if it even was olive it had no olive taste or color so either low quality or not even olive. I have had better hummus buying pre-packaged at the grocery stores. Baba did not impress either, sad that I have made it once at home from an online recipe & my guests loved that, this one taste was enough. I will continue to drive on to Stephano's when craving some baba. I love falafel, to the extreme that when I go to Parsley Mediterranean Grill, as soon as I walk in they ask me how many orders of falafel I want that day. Here, when I called before going to see if they were gluten-free, I was told they are made from a mix which is gluten free - garbanzo, fava & corn oil. But judging from the shape & texture - these were like balls of bean flavored cake - almost like cupcake consistency. Were they baked or fried? There wasn't oil on the plate under them & they soaked up the tahini that was squirted on them. Baked would be healthier, but these just didn't cut it for me. I ate  1/2 of one & it came with 4. Yes, I left hungry having eaten less than 2 full bites of a $10 plate. His kebab plate which he ordered the chicken charred wasn't even showing a speck of char on the second trip from the grill (yes we know it's unhealthy charred but it's how he likes it & ordered it). The Greek salad on the plate was drenched in oil so it was flavorless because as I've said, the oil has no color or taste. Probably why there is so much paprika spread on the top, guess not just for presentation but if any taste is desired, mix it in. Maybe they were in a rush to get out since it was about closing time, but for $30 with the above, an order of their garlic feta fries & a can of soda , if eating off plastic plates & utensils the food should be good.  This kind of reminds me of food in a mall's food court, not a stand alone restaurant Food was 1 star, service would have been 3 but couldn't get his char on, cleanliness is what brought them up to 2 stars.  Still trying to figure out all those 5-star reviews. I use yelp all the time to find great new places, but this time I feel really let down. Maybe for meat eaters this is good, but definitely don't recommend for a vegan.

dcv6hRSge5zu3YCBsR0dhA.text: Hubs and I stopped on our way thru Vegas for lunch. Holy gamoley!! Fabulous food and lots of it. Gyros and garlic fries were to die for. No room for dessert but their Turkish style baklava liked yummy. Great service and a quick stop. They've just added a Music podium and plan to have live music starting in April. Will definitely be back.

vprOYfovLC6TPrn2WSYGww.text: Food was delicious!  I ate my side salad first and they noticed I had not eaten my platter just yet, they brought me a fresh hot one!!! That's excellent service. I was taken by surprise. Definitely recommend eating here if you are looking for good Greek food. The gyro meat is sliced a little thicker than most places and they are not stingy with it!

IE1wAxqp_6VdJxmz0gAFfA.text: Yummy, yummy! I checked out this place due to the reviews on yelp. The gyros, filet kabob and chicken are so good! Feta fries are a must..! My favorite Greek place in Las Vegas so far.

rBAkl897GVGrbJHy4ZzRFQ.text: We ordered two gyros with fries. They have a great menu selection including chicken and vegetarian if you don't like beef or lamb. Fantastic Greek, some of the very best that we have had in the country. Everything was fresh and tasted great!

xCjOBHuw_SJSfrXrlCEi1Q.text: I'm Lebanese and i tried this place based on reviews.   Very disappointed.   First off the hummus was watery with no flavor.   Then I tried the chicken Shawarma which  was way to dry,  does not even look like shawarma,  just looks like chicken on rice and the falafel was way over cooked and with no flavor.  Never will return again, what an insult.  Try your food before you serve it!!!!

dnasdgZShS-GFkES14JCRA.text: This was a magical experience. I liked the dolmas (I never like dolmas). Everything was super delicious. The staff was awesome, and the prices were excellent. I will be back.

Oy1fQpT3wzAbYexsUn8tlA.text: Had the beef and lamb shwarma... So awesome! Delicious. Really friendly and great service.

00q8P3nnPHO7-jtzraGR7Q.text: Wow. Incredible gyro. Portion was huge, perfectly sliced and cooked meat, accented with parsley, and the sauce was very dill'd which is my favorite.. Will definitely be back

fSxad_MxvrLeh-3GL68YCw.text: Don't get me wrong, the chicken shwarma(sp.) is sooo de-lish.  I only felt that I had to dock a star on service.  I don't know where this great, family friendly employees are, but I do know that those characters DO NOT exist at Yanni's.  The tall dark-haired young man at the register seemed less than enthusiastic to take my order.  His demeanor was as dry as stale bread.  I don't need a pep squad when ordering food at a restaurant, but at the very least - please treat me as though I am welcome.  As I mentioned previously, I had the chicken shwarma with a side salad.  2 thumbs up on the cuisine, 1 thumb down on service.

z4i3a3xV-TGFY6XiSZbhLQ.text: Have eaten here once and ordered take out a few times... Everything I had was excellent!! The chicken kabob plate filled me up!! Will definitely be ordering or visiting time and time again!!

A-PyQKeUHS1imEwDf8TCMw.text: I wish I never heard of this place. Mainly because I'll be eating here 3 times a week. Good gyro, great Greek fries. Real Greek experience.

GTSMpyB9RbkFys7Q4-1kDw.text: One of the best gyros on the Eastside.  Yanni's Greek Grill is a no-frills diner with focus on great tasting Greek food.  The owner does the cooking in an open area with his wife (I think).  Strangely, the cooking area behind the counter is 3-4 times bigger than the dining area, which only has 2-3 tables (there are more tables outside).  The owner is very friendly and easygoing.  We asked if there was any relation to Yanni's Gyros.  He said that he used to own it, sold it, and opened up this new place.  I followed up with "So that means the food here is better than the other place, right?"  The owner smiled and said he wasn't sure.  I got the shawarma pita combo with the garlic freta fries.  The shawarma uses the same meat as the gyro, except instead of tzaziki sauce, it comes with shawarma sauce.  I found the shawarma sauce to be in-between the creamy white tzaziki sauce and the heavy hummus mix.  I asked for some tzaziki sauce and converted the second half of my pita into a normal gyro, which I preferred more.  The gyro/shawarma pita is huge.  The gyro meat was delicious, tasty with consistent texture.  The pita came with significantly more meat than Yanni's Gyros; I didn't taste any difference in the meat between the two, but my friend said that the meat at Yanni's Greek Grill was a little saltier.  The garlic fries were tasty and similar to that offered by Yanni's Gyros.   What to do: Order and pay at the counter.  The owner will then bring the food to your table, along with plastic utensils and napkins.  When finished, just leave your plates at the table and the owner will cleanup.  Tip jar is located on the counter.  There is plenty of parking in the mall lot.  There is no public restroom in the restaurant.

xRdzxY1sUli1w9OiZ4on9A.text: Walked in. Ordered. Got my food in five minuets or so. They weren't very busy. I got the food to go. I got the gyro platter. The food is awesome. Would recommend it to anyone. There aren't many Greek restaurants in town. I will definitely be back.
